text: went for wifes birthday, food was slow and over cooked, waitter was more interested in talking to friends than wait on us , they had 3 tables all night, no management or they dont care. very over priced for medium quality get a chef who knows how to make pasta not mush......very disappointed

Nieve Malandra sings in the bar area of Siena on Friday night from 8:00-11:00. She is gorgeous and a very, very good singer. She helps establish a terrific atmosphere in the restaurant. The food is very good. Josh and the rest of the staff are very friendly and accommodating. Siena is located at 9500 West Sahara (near Fort Apache and Sahara). If you are looking for a laid back atmosphere with great food, do yourself a favor and check out Siena on Friday evening.

The room feels slightly empty, but it's still a decent place to go for dinner. Not really a "date night" feel. 

The food is 3.5 star. Most of their dishes come with home made pasta. Their meats and cheeses are said to be aged and cured in house- which were delicious. Their desserts need some work. We ordered the tiramisu, which lacked the rum, so it was dry, a banana split that was made with gelato and the canolis. The cream in the canolis had too much citrus, it was overwhelming. 

The bar has several different types of wine, but they don't know how to make an old fashion. When I described it, they literally threw an orange slice and a cherry into a big glass of bourbon. 

The reason for the 4 star was because of Pasquale.  He makes this restaurant. His service is so personalized and so genuine. Although it wasn't busy, he made us feel like the only table in the restaurant. We will come back because of him.

UNREAL happy hour menu at the bar (check out the photos I posted)!  All the items are full sized and yummy. Had the calamari and the eggplant Parmesan as an appetizer. Both were huge and darn near enough for a small entree. For main course got the penne a la vodka and added scallops... Fantastic!  Also had the seafood special risotto. Really good as well. If Julio is working the bar, he won't lead you wrong. This is now my "go to" Sunday dinner spot when in Vegas. Check it out. You won't be sorry.

I'd visited this neighborhood establishment a few years ago to have drinks and had a good time. Fast forward my husband and I decided to have dinner/music at Siena a couple of weeks ago. Prior to going for dinner, I'd read a review that a customer experienced poor service that she felt was due to her party not ordering cocktails with dinner. I thought nothing of this review until we experienced the same. Upon our arrival to Siena (about 7:45pm/Saturday night) we were greeted by the bus boy immediately. Unfortunately the waitress arrived much later. We noticed she would disappear for long periods on this seemingly un-busy evening. After we ordered dinner (no cocktails) we became famished. It took over 50 minutes for our Shrimp dishes to prepare. We prepared to walkout however the food arrived at that very moment. Our plan was to have dinner then take in some cocktails/music at the bar afterwards. Despite the poor service we stuck with the plan and had martinis at the bar. The atmosphere (new d√©cor) and the music were a nice touch but not enough to alleviate the poor dining experience.
We won't be back. I should add that my husband NEVER complains. On this occasion he actually directed me to take the time to share our experience with others. Choose another Italian restaurant.

For 25 years since I've lived in Las Vegas I always went to Siena Deli on Trop & Eastern for the "Best Fresh Hot Italian Sausage" and finally I get the chance to get over to the fancy new location on West Sahara to get out fix.  The Siena deli is now by far much more organized, lavished and beautiful.  However, their sausage is now a whopping $7 bucks a pound (it use to be $4-5 per pound)........but no biggie, everything has gone up.  I was so excited to taste it, so I get home, my hubby makes his sauce opens up the bag to add the sausage and first thing I notice is the sausage has no color (hot is usually red from the pepper and spice) and just by the look we can tell it is not the same quality and not to our surprise the flavor is not the same either.  The new product is mediocre, boring, and basically tasteless....total bummer and a big disappointment.  If you step it up & spice it up, we may be back but for 7 bucks a pound it better be made with kurobuta pork.  Too bad, it is so sad to see that another good ole Vegas establishment gone bad.  Adios to the good ole Siena that once was:(

This review is for the Trattoria half of this business. I am a long time customer of the Siena Deli that was at Tropicana and Eastern. I used to eat lunch there whenever I was within 5 miles when I used to have my mobile computer repair business in Las Vegas. After I moved to Colorado I always ended my road trips to Vegas with a stop to get lunch and to purchase some sausage or other Italian meats to put in a cooler to take home with me. So when I heard that Siena closed my old favorite Deli and opened a Trattoria/Deli I couldn't wait to give it a try. Needless to say by my 3 stars that my first trip to the new place wasn't a good one, if it wasn't for the food I would have given them 1 or 2 stars and maybe my Italian anger is still too strong to write a fair review but here's what happened. 

My wife had received an anniversary coupon from their email club so when we were back home on a business trip celebrating our anniversary we drove all the way up the west end of Sahara. My wife ordered the Ravioli Burro E Salvia (Cheese Raviolis on Marinara with a butter sage reduction) and I ordered the Sausage pinwheel with a side of Broccoli Rape, I always knew this as Robbies, Broccoli Rabe or Rapini. My wife loved her Raviolis and I really enjoyed the Sausage. But when I asked the waiter if they had Broccoli Rabe thinking that it might be out of season and he said yes, I was excited as it's hard to find in Denver and I love Robbies. When my meal was delivered on my plate was Broccoletti or Broccotini, I told my waiter that this was not what I ordered but he insisted that what was on my plate was "Rapini". Then to try and convince me he called over another waiter and he also argued with me saying that the Broccoletti was Broccoli Rabe or Rapini. Now, I've been eating Broccoli Rabe my entire life and know the difference between the two and getting into an argument with 2 NON-Italian waiters over what I ordered made me very angry on a night I was trying to celebrate my anniversary. I told him to tell the chef that what he served me was not Broccoli Rabe. When I finished my Sausage the waiter returned saying that the chef apologizes and offered us a dessert compliments of the house. This started to make me feel better. He took away my plate with the Broccoletti that I didn't eat and brought us our dessert.....Spumoni. On their dessert menu they described the Spumoni as chocolate, pistachio and strawberry gelato with whipped cream. What he brought was only chocolate and pistachio gelato, no whipped cream but it was very good anyway. I wasn't going to look a gift horse in the mouth and was thankful for the free dessert. Then I got the bill. They charged me $2.00 for the Broccoletti that I did not order or eat! I waited for the manager to come to the table but I guess an unhappy customer wasn't worth his time. 

When I go to an "Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli" I don't want to order something "Italian" from their menu and then told by two Spanish speaking waiters that I don't know what I ordered. I predict that Sienna will go out of business if they don't hire better waiters that know about Italian foods and what is on their menu. Arguing with Italian customers in an Italian restaurant over Italian food is just plain stupid. If I wasn't with my wife I might have reacted a bit differently and the manager wouldn't have had a choice but to intervene.

Loved this place!! Prices are very reasonable, atmosphere is not stuffy, service was great, and the food was fantastic!!  We ordered 5 different pastas that everyone enjoyed. They were able to make a buffalo mozzarella with praschutto for me by request.  I finished the evening off with a very good cannolo. Bottom line is we WILL be back!!

Well the service was five stars. The bread with the olive paste really good. Ehhhh I think that is where it stops. The calamari was bland and too salty the sauce was spicy and decent. I ordered the pesto gnocchi it was mediocre like chef boyardi with green sauce. My partner had the steak and it just had way too too much pepper and the Alfredo sauce for the pasta well let's just say it made Olive Garden look like Ruth Chris steakhouse. The dessert was good. So dessert and bread yes, but food heck no. The portions were also very large just wished I likes my food....

Disappointing experience, to say the least.  

They were taking reservations until 10:30 p.m. on Open Table.  I made a confirmed reservation for 10:00 p.m., picked-up a family member at the airport, drove cross-town for dinner, arrived on time, but was told they were closing the kitchen at 10:00 that night.  They had "neglected" to change their operating hours on Open Table.

Now I was on the west side of the city with no other decent restaurants still open.
Very good food, service was great, not too busy for dinner on a saturday. and there was a band playing in the background that made it a little more interesting.
This is consider one of the worst restaurant. The service was bad, food took forever to be ready, and the portions was small. I will not go back again.

We visited Siena in the past on two occasions and thought it would be a great location to celebrate a birthday - made a reservation in advance just in case since there are 7 of us all-together.  The table was waiting for us on arrival so that was great to not have to wait. 

While waiting for everyone to arrive, we decided to order a bottle of wine and some appetizers.  Did not realize that all the advertisements for Happy Hour only apply to the Bar area - not to the main dining room.  Either way, we ordered the charcuterie board and some fried calamari and a bottle of wine. The bread service came with a small amount of sliced bread and a large amount of 'lavosh' and a small ramekin of olive tapenade.  Not enough bread, especially with the meat and cheese platter we ordered.  Had to ask for more as well as some oil and vinegar - this would normally be brought out with the meat platter automatically.  Not the case.

Once the rest of our party arrived, we proceeded to order some salads and main courses.  The burratta appetizer/salad had a good size portion with a few small sliced heirloom tomatoes and olives.  The other salads were nothing to write home about - the Caesar had a large amount of croutons and very little dressing as well as Ruchetta which was a very small portion (although we did order the small) and again, little dressing.  Our dinners came out just as we took our last bites of salad.  

One guest had the Linguine Vongole - this was the absolute worst "linguine and clams" I have ever experienced.  There was no seasoning/herbs present in the broth and all of the clams that were on top for garnish, had NO clams inside!  No amount of salt and pepper could save this dish.  The Cavatelli con Salsiccia looked extremely dry with very little tomato sauce.  We tried rescuing it with some leftover sauce from the calamari.  It actually looked as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp waiting for the rest of the dishes. The other dishes (Rigatoni, Gnocci, Penne Vodka, Ravioli, Lasagna) were all just OK.  The server did come back and ask how everything was so I can say the service was good; however it was not worth sending the dishes back as we were not confident in anything being better.

Being that it was a birthday, I had asked if they could bring out a cannoli with a candle - no problem receiving this however it was the worst cannoli we have ever had.  We could not determine what was in the filling (there was a distinct alcohol taste that we could not figure out).  We asked the server what the filling was made with and were told "ricotta and cream".  NO WAY!  My guess, amaretto of some sort.

Overall, what we thought was going to be a great family dinner turned out to be just a sub-par dinner with good company. I can say for sure that we will NOT return.  Clue to a bad dinner:  when you walk out from a $300 meal and need to hit the closest In-and-Out drive thru!!!

I recently moved to Las Vegas and had a truly delightful experience at Siena Italian restaurant yesterday, one which I am still contemplating. For some time now I have had a deep feeling of sorrow of times past when one could go to a restaurant and have a REAL meal and enjoy a feeling of authenticity with both the food and with who is serving you. An authentic Italian meal where the meats are processed on the premise, the pastas and breads are made fresh and the server, a true Italian gentleman, explained the meals and offered to change whatever I may not like. 

I loved everything. The food was real food, prepared like it has always been done for generations. The atmosphere reminded me of my childhood when my family would go to a nice restaurant. It was a privilege to dine out and we would dressed up, always on our best behavior. I remember then the linen table clothes and the servers attention to detail. The fresh dinner rolls and so on. This place has the same ambiance. 

This place, it is not just a restaurant, but a place out of time to give you the gift of memories, whether the atmosphere triggers it or the food itself...this place made me feel at home for the first time since I moved here. It made wish that I was Italian for just a bit.:) I had remarked to my husband that I couldn't remember the last time that a meal made me this happy, where you moan with delight...certainly the Torta Lunga did that for both us! 

This is the place to bring your friends and family too. I am also delighted to read that they also have bands that play on certain days in both the mid morning and evening.

After our lovely dinner we browsed the deli area and felt so blessed to have this deli/ restaurant down the street from where we live. 

Thanks to Pasquale for a wonderful experience. Deborah
So glad to of found the original Siena Deli, got a Italian sub sandwich,  kind of skimpy on the meet.... will go and try again, just to make sure!

We first came here as we read about the highly-rated Deli in the LVRJ, which by the way, is fantastic and offers a plethora of goods directly from Italy. They have it all; a fresh deli case filled with pancetta, mortadella, homemade Italian sausage, olive bar and cheeses to a freezer filled with home-made pasta and a hot entree bar. They offer dry goods that range from jars and cans of imported tomatoes, sauce, bruschetta, peppers and outstanding dry pasta. And they have home-made gelato in your typical Italian flavors... highlighted by the spumoni and pistachio! And don't forget about the bread case... from chibiatta to round, yummy loaves of goodness crispy on the outside and soft inside! A little imported olive oil and you're done! 

You can eat in the casual deli... or  the restaurant which is comfortable and unassuming. We came back for the restaurant and were not disappointed. Everything our party ordered was fresh and authentic.  We stared with a different and delicious Ruchetta salad containing arugula tossed with figs and dry ricotta, Champagne vinagrette & figs glace. The cream sauce of the fettachini alfredo was outstanding.  Try the Cavatelli con Salsiccia, a rustic dish filled with a spicy sausage ragout, fresh herbs, tomato sauce & Pecorino Cheese. If you're in the mood for Italian... definitely come here!

Came to eat at Siena tonight and I was blown away with how nice this restaurant is . They have an amazing relaxing lounge area with a very reasonable happy hour . The foot tasted amazing and I could tell everything was fresh . But over all the best thing about my experience was the service . My server LiLi was the icing on the cake . She was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu . Thanks for an unforgettable experience LiLi . I'll definitely be recommending this place to friend !
Food is delishous...specially ravioli. And their bread...I don't like olives but their olive tapanada is excellent.  And deserts are so good you will finish it even you are full.

Not Thrilled,sauce had no flavor, bread was old and not what a Italian restaurant should serve, ate a spaghetti bolognese and I left hungry I felt the portion was small, overpriced, no flavor, gonna try a different place because I wouldn't go back.
Everything was normal. Nothing to special. The only thing that stood out was the quick and attentive service.

Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli is one of the best places that you can dine locally in Vegas without having to visit all of the Hotels. They have a great location near the heart of Summerlin. Their authentic dishes are outstanding as well as the prompt service that their staff's provide. Thank you so much for creating this wonderful dining venue Chef Giancarlo Bomparola!!! ?(?)?

Do NOT believe the hype. I have been here four times.  Each time something worse happens. I'm not sure who is to blame for the poorly behaved and badly trained wait staff, but one thing I can say for sure, after the fourth visit, is that the poor service and way below average food quality are definitely consistent!

My last (and final) visit to this restaurant included:  frozen, reheated crab cakes, that were disgusting; an 11.00 spinach salad that consisted exactly of spinach, six raw walnuts, and 5 pieces of artichoke hearts;  and then there was the entree.  The entree was our final knife in the gut and pocket book.  We ordered the lobster and steak special.  We specifically asked the waiter for a filet cut of steak.  He served us a small piece of grisly meat that my giant, sharp, steak knife, literally could not cut through!  When we told him it was not filet, he was condescending and rude and acted like we didn't know what we were talking about!  Grrr!  

We were highly insulted that they would pass this horrible quality and poorly made menu items off as authentic Italian cuisine. If that is authentic Italian cuisine, no one would ever lay claim to it!

The manager half heartedly apologized, although she seemed more worried about upsetting the condescending waiter than she was concerned about our horrible experience, and she removed the uneaten special from our bill.  

I have not ever wrote a bad restaurant review, however, they should not be able to get away with this in a city filled with amazing restaurant options.   I hope that they can address their issues and be an asset to our community in the future.

Decent food. Portion size is a little small for the price. The clams were definitely not fresh. A few of them had sand in them. The Alfredo tasted like they didn't drain the pasta well.  Great variety of cheese and appetizers. Service was mediocre. I will try the deli next time but probably won't be going back for pasta.

Giancarlo is nice man and an honorable man as well, unfortunately his female bar manager and bartenders are not. I use to sop there frequently for cocktails but not anymore. After I paid my bill with my credit card I left one afternoon and I checked my credit card statement on line. The female bar manager and bartenders continued to make many multiple  charges on my card, EVEN THOUGH I WAS NOT THERE. I printed a copy of the statement and took a my credit card charge receipt directly to Giancarlo and he took care of the issue immediately. I have notified Las Vegas Metro Police of the employees I believed were involved in credit card fraud and never went back. A very nice environment  and owner but beware of the employees. I wonder how many other people who do not check their credit card statements have been victims of the employees?

This is my very favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas.  Service - perfect.  Food - Outstanding.  

They have specials every night and when they have the Branzino (Striped Bass), it is what I order.  They serve it table side, de-boning and plating the fish and vegetables right in front of you.  The lemon caper sauce is delicious, I always ask for a little extra.  No matter what you order on the special menu, it is fresh and in season and wonderful.

We have friends that we go with quite a bit, and one of our companions orders the Chicken Marsala every time.  It is his favorite dish and he can't get away from it.

Order the charcuterie plate for appetizer.  Onsite they have an Italian shop with meats, cheeses, olives, gelato, and other worldly goodies.  The meat and cheeses on the plate are from the shop.  The portion is very generous - quite enough for four or five people. 

The menu is just enough of everything Italian from the appetizers, salads, pizza and traditional Italian dishes.  Everything we have ordered has been fabulous.  This is definitely our "go-to" Italian place!

The meal was perfect. Start off they bring you some bread and home made pasta chips. To top it off they add this fantastic crushed olive spread. So good had to buy some chips and spread to take home to my daughter. The Chicken Marsala was tender and perfect.  Best yet, the flourless Chocolate cake, SOOOO Good. Definitely a place I will come to eat when back in town. The service as well gets five star.

I`ve been there once and I don`t plan on ever coming back. We had bruschetta, cannelloni from the lunch menu and pepperoni pizza. The bruschetta was ok, but the cannelloni and the pizza were very bad. I know Italian food and it is not this. I am feeling sick whole day after eating there. I am giving 2 stars because the bruschetta was edible and the wine we had was also nice  (Marlborough sauvignon blanc)

First off, getting into the booth is a tight squeeze!! The table is very close..The menu was a bit difficult to read with no
Pictures, and the names were a bit different. We also had to ask for olive oil and butter for the bread. I got the ham fettuccini Alfredo & it was undercooked , and our pizza was a bit soggy.
Excellent Food , Drink and Amazing Music . This evening had StefnRock added an incredible mood with thier music . Great Service and Atmosphere .

Before reading my review, take note: I didn't order anything Itaian! Went here for a business lunch meeting. I ordered one of the lunch specials,  ahi tuna, which was served with seared asparagus. Very good. Generous portion. My lunch oompanion ordered the salad with crab, which looked really good. I was impressed with the adjacent market/deli as well.  Many of the regular items on the menu seemed a bit pricey to me, but I enjoyed the atmosphere and my food was excellent.  No problem when I asked for butter sauce on the side.

I went here for dinner with my family and was disappointed.  We got gnocchi, fish of the day (tuna), and the seafood platter.  The food just wasn't great, and for the prices I would expect higher quality.

Well after my second visit I have decide this is my new favorite dining establishment food was awesome and affordable live entertainment on Weds evening is welcoming and very well done.. Not over done... And the wait staff I'm sure was hand selected by the owner This is a must try Happy Hour is every hour as I was told and there wines are perfect and 50% off most of the dinner hours I enjoy the Santa Christine and sure you will as well

This is for the restaurant:
All of the Yelp reviewers criticizing this establishment are spot on...
Server? Rude. Very rude. I also had to keep reminding the person to bring me things I requested earlier. I finally gave up. 
Food? Not great. My entree had over cooked pasta. My dining companion's lasagne had cold meatballs in it. My cookies looked and tasted old. I bit into one and it literally crumbled into pieces. I ended up "trying" them all, but eating only one. 
Entertainment? A bit loud, but the band was tight and the drummer was amazing. 
Do I recommend? Like other Yelp reviewers said, you'd think this place would try harder to present "authentic" Italian food when there's so much competition here in Vegas. So no, I do not recommend this restaurant. This was my second visit with the same experience.

Great set up with a bar section, table dining and a deli. Good solid food and great atmosphere for either of the three you are looking for!
Great Owner....
Check this place out!

Among the many things I love about this restaurant is the fact that you never know what the entertainment will be, however, you can rely on the fact that there will be some kind of live entertainment. I've seen big bands, solo artists, folk singers, jazz, you name it. The staff is absolutely, positively like the cast of "Cheers" except they are serving gourmet food and concocting delicious martini's and Manhattan's. Todd, the guy who tends bar is funny, very spirited, but above all makes fantastic cocktails. And, seriously...could the staff be anymore good looking?! John Carlo, the owner, he must be there nightly because every time I've been in he's there, but not in a "boss" checking up on his staff kind of way, but being a part of what is going on. The food is delicious and as I've been to many parts of Italy, I find this place to be extremely authentic..the food is beautiful and they have a deli to boot!! If you are looking for ambiance, gourmet meals, fancy cocktails and entertainment, but don't feel like dressing to the nines, come here and enjoy a night of pure Italian bliss!

The Deli: Only place in town selling Fresh Yeast. 
 
The Pastries are Excellent. Excellent Fresh Italian Sausage.

We went there on Friday night.. The restaurant was pretty empty around 9 pm.. They had live music gong and a few people were dancing near the bar,, the restaurant is a great neighborhood spot just minutes from boca park and red rock casino..

We ordered the vegan healthy pasta. I must say the pasta was absolutely fabulous,, we had asked for extra vegetables. The restaurants charged $3 extra per plate for the extra veges. I would have thought it would have been prudent for the waiter to let us know of the extra charge but this was not the case.. Also, since they had to open a brand new pasta box for the whole wheat penne, they asked if we want to take the remaining pasta home at a charge of $3.. We ended up paying about $20 per pasta plate.. Granted the pasta was really well done, I am not sure if $20 per pasta plate for a neighborhood restaurant is worth it..

The service was good.. Our waiter was extremely friendly..

While we may go back to the restaurant sometime in the distant future, I think there are a lot of other neighborhood restaurants serving similar or better Italian 
 food at a more reasonable price point,..

We were in last night as still looking for great Italian in Vegas.  This restaurant is very nice, food was good.  Nothing spectacular.  We went into the deli/bakery to grab a couple of macaroons.  They were VERY dry and could tell they had been sitting there for a few days.  Not overly impressed with this place as the management should ensure better quality, but will give it another try to see if this was just an off night.

I saw this place while my husband and I were driving in Sahara. We gave it a try. And we've been there 3x as of this writing. On our first visit, I ordered the shrimp scampi and my husband got a salmon sandwich. Both orders were delicious. And that's why we came back again. On our second visit, we ordered shrimp scampi (again for me!) and lasagna. We were again left smiling with the food. On our third visit, my husband ordered the eggplant parmesan and a lobster ravioli. The eggplant parmesan was good and we love the lobster ravioli. Their bread pudding is delicious. It's a nice local italian place. We will definitely come back. And btw, service is good as well.
We ordered 25 cheese and meat trays from this place.  They accommodated our short time frame and the trays looked superb!  I will defiantly be using them in the future for all party platters.

I love this place! Their deli is small, but the specialty food they have I can't find anywhere else in town. The quality is good and the service is excellent. They've got a cold calamari salad and tomato/cucumber/onion salad that are exceptional! If you're into Italian food, this is the place for you. It reminds me of the Italian Deli I'd visit on the east coast.

Taste was okay, but preparation  and service very bad.  Pasta was clumped and could not separate.  Told waitress and she stated she would tell cook and offered to replace the noodles.  No way that would happen since the wait would likely be 20 minutes.  I simple ate the topping and left the noodles.  No sorry about the quality.   Better food at the Olive Garden.

My cutie petutie is straight from NYC and he's the biggest deli snob ever.  If he doesn't feel good about the authenticity of a deli, it is not unheard of for us to walk out.  He takes one look and knows if its legit.

Well, he loved this place.  The food tasted home cooked and the portions were huge... did I mention the reasonable prices?  

I had the sausage and peppers special with a side of garlic knots.  I would definitely recommend... especially since it passed my boyfriend's sniff test.

We went for lunch a few days ago. Nice and A/C's on a hot day. We stood waiting for attention at the counter for about 5-10 minutes before being acknowledged, but we got our order in, got some drinks paid and sat down to wait for the food, which came pretty quickly.
The caesar was great. Our sandwich ( the Siena chicken cutlet) was bland but big. The Cavatelli with Ragout was just as flavorless but considering it was the signature pasta dish according to their posted menu, it was terrible. The Italian dude that served us was cool though and took care of our table. Groovy Italian music videos gave the dining space some ambiance. 
Prices have gone up since they posted their menu online. 

They seem like nice people and there were some potentially good choices in the deli cases, and we had high hopes after the glowing reviews, especially after getting into the caesar salad, but the experience took a nose-dive with the main dishes. $40 after a tip and a couple sodas for crummy food.  We probably won't make it back to try the pizza. Sorry boys.
Overall I'd recommend Tivoli Gardens: It's right down the street, the prices are the same, the food is better and it's an actual restaurant where you're served at a nice linened table.

The food is good. Their menu has lots of options. The cheese sampler is awesome. You can try a variety of Italian cheeses you may never have heard of, hard and soft. So good, much better than Brio and God forbid, Olive Garden.

My husband and a few of his close friends tried this place for lunch one day and had a great lunch! He was so pleased with his experience he wanted to take me there for dinner. We started with calamari which was so greasy we could hardly eat it. The pieces were literally dripping with grease. 
For main course I ordered the special of the day which was seared ahi tuna. It was charred and totally cooked thru. It was more like a tough steak than a piece of fish. I sent it back and ordered the salmon instead. The salmon was burned as well and so salty it was inedible. 
Needless to say we left and had to eat elsewhere. 
The bright light is the service. Friendly and attentive! The staff made an awful dining experience somewhat tolerable. 
Needless to say I won't be dining again here unless things really change in the kitchen!

We love Siena! They have a great selection of seafood specials, as well as traditional italian dishes. Their olive tapenade that comes with the bread is delicious. We ordered the striped Sea bass (branzino) which they clean and filet in front of you, and the seafood black risotto topped with lobster tail; both dishes were super fresh, light and tasty. I also recommend, the Layer Cake Primitivo from the Puglia region, if you like a full body wine. Giancarlo, Siena's owner, personally stopped by the table to make sure, everything was perfect. Service from Juanelle was also impeccable!

I made a dinner reservation for a moderate size party for Christmas Eve and specifically told them that I did not want the banquet room.  However when we arrived and were seated in a somewhat isolated room away from the dinning room, I inquired about if we were in the banquet room, which our waiter denied. (the reason it annoyed me was because I was also informed that there was no "special" menu, which it WAS!) My family is a big fan of eggplant parm and they would not accommodate either. Overall, the food was 6/10, the service staff were fairly personable. I was building this place up for my friends & family and instead all I heard was an earful about their experience. We still had a Merry Christmas nonetheless. Prob won't go back.

This place makes me sad.  For so many reasons.  I so wanted it to be good.  I'd so enjoyed the food over the years at Siena's (now closed) location near UNLV.  Walk in, it's pretty, it's dark, obviously what someone's been dreaming of for years.  The menu is pretty large, but it's one of those menus where you look at it, and there's nothing that jumps out at you.  OK, maybe that's just my taste...  

A salad was so drenched in dressing I felt sorry for the spinach (and it should've been called a 'walnut salad' not a spinach salad since it was chock-full of walnuts, but not much spinach...weird...)  A pizza was solid (it's always been one of their strengths,) and pretty good value...easily big enough for 2 people (or 1 person's dinner AND lunch the next day.)  

I took a peek into the deli next door and it was the familiar Siena fare, although it seemed pricier than the original location (like I never remember paying $7.99 a pound for their hot sausage.)

Finally, our waiter just kinda seemed to be wandering around aimlessly a lot of the time.  As I've mentioned before, I hate places where runners and bus staff have to pick up the slack all the time for less-than-competent waitstaff, and that was definitely the case here, at least with our waiter.  The slack was picked up really well by a really efficient bus person...but shouldn't be that way.

I stopped in to try the new deli over the weekend. It's been far too long since I consumed my favorite Italian eats. The sicilian and eggplant sandwiches were as good as ever before. It was great to have a fix. Pizza is still getting up and running so I'll have to make another visit soon for a slice of ricotta and spinach.

Ok we were craving Italian food and wanted some hearty dishes! We decided to try Siena out! The moment we walked in the hostess was on her iPhone. I totally get that places get boring but she was not wanting to give the time of day! The place was packed and the first thing I noticed was the decor.. It was very....blah. 
The deli was amazing, our waitress was great and the food was so-so. I believe in second chances so I'm willing to go back and hope to be won over :)

This is my favorite Italian Restaurant.

As soon as we get in we were greeted by the hostess with a smile.
We were seated in front of the kitchen and you can see the cooking action.

We had Calamari for an appetizer, it was properly battered and cooked to perfection.

Had Fruti di Mari, Fettuccini Alfredo and Halibut for the entree.

It was really made fresh and with gusto.

Dessert found us with a helping of Tiramisu to share and a finale of freshly made frothing Cappuccino.

The service team of Gloria and the bus person were attentive, friendly and all smiles 

We bought some items from the Deli too.
Personnels were friendly likewise.

A must place to visit.

We dined there 7/20/2017.  It took between 10 and 15 minutes for them to come to us after we were seated.  No water or bread for 10-15 minutes.  Don't know why, because they were not too busy and it was at 7pm.  The food portions are small, but the food was good.  I never got a refill for my water glass, even though it sat empty the entire time after the initial pour.  Although I did not ask for a refill as I am pretty passive.  The lasagna was super hot on one side, and just luke warm in the middle.  I don't complain much, so It was ok.  I live close by and will try them again and update my review.

This restaurant is so good! Super authentic food, pastries and deli selections as well as a wide artist of imported foods and wines. I recently moved to NV and I will be making this restaurant a regular stop.
Great Italian sandwiches on fresh in-house baked bread! Nice supply of Italian pasta and canned goods.

SIENA is our go  to Restaurant! THE food is consistently good.  The specials are unique, high quality and great value.  THE staff is always friendly and knowledgeable about the food and specials.  EVERYONE we have brought to the restaurant have enjoyed their meals.  KUDOS to CHEF GIANCARLO and his Staff!

I went there for Happy Hour last week.  Good deal on the wine prices and I was happy to hear that they have Happy Hour drink prices all day on Sundays.  However, the inside bar is very limited on space.   They had an outside patio that is enclosed with a/c and the bar extends onto the patio but the furniture out there it mismatched and it has a feel of being a bit rundown on the patio.  I would like to back and hear the live music (no music during happy hour).   The happy hour bar snacks were pretty good but not outstanding.

I had dinner the other night ! I was so dissapointed, the service was horrible, we could never finder our server! The veal was dry, the chicken was not cooked, cmon you guys used to be great, was 1 of my davorites for business dinners or lunch, but dont think i will be back!
Awesome place with a great Happy Hour!  Older crowd and great prices!!!!  Service is top notch and the bartenders are excellent! One of my favorite spots!!!
Love coming to this restaurant good service and excellent food great pizzas and salad
Lobster ravolis here are awesome...  great to buy pasta and sauces, but deserts are not of the same caliber...
Bar on one side, a deli on the other, with a great restaurant in between. Incredible staff. Unbelievable dining.

I'm perplexed by the Las Vegas Review-Journal readers who perpetually name the Olive Garden as Best Italian Restaurant, especially when there are so many better Italian restaurants in this city. And Siena is among the best I've been to. 

My husband and I stopped in for an early dinner last night. Happy hour was in full swing in the bar, but we chose to sit in the restaurant. They have half-price bottles of wine on Tuesdays, so that was a bonus! We split a bottle of Sangiovese, which was also offered by the glass. And then we perused the menu, which offered the old classics along with a few modern twists.

Although we weren't too hungry, we couldn't pass up an appetizer of four meats brought over directly from the deli next door. We chose mortadella (fancy bologna), prosciutto (fancy ham), sopressata (fancy salami), and bresaola (fancy chipped beef). My husband is crazy about mortadella, and he said this one was great. I'm not a big fan of mortadella (although I did try a slice), but I really liked the other three meats, especially the bresaola. The meats were served on a long platter with a few olives as garnish. They also offer an assortment of cheeses this way; too bad they don't have a mix-and-match meat and cheese platter as an option. (I guess you could create one yourself, but I didn't see anything offering less than four choices, and four meats and four cheeses would have been a lot for just us two.)

For our entrees, I had the ravioli burro e salvia, which is cheese ravioli served on marinara and topped with a brown butter sage sauce. I liked this a lot, although I could have done without the marinara; the butter sauce was fine on its own. My husband got one of the daily specials: riblets with a side of pasta. An Italian restaurant is the last place I would expect to find riblets, but these certainly fit in with the Mediterranean-themed menu. They were lightly seasoned and grilled over the wood fire, and the pasta was nicely dressed with parm. Sides and salads were extra, and we had neither, although we didn't really need them because we both ended up taking home leftovers.

Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, and the food would make any true Italian proud. I can't wait to go back to the deli to pick up some bresaola (and some mortadella for the spouse), or maybe stop in for happy hour to try half-price apps and drinks. Now if we can only get some of those Olive Garden fans through the door!

The place has two sides, a deli (on the right) and the Trattoria on the left. I've enjoyed both!
Tried the deli side yesterday, and it was exactly the treat that I'd been hoping for. It's a nice well lit open space, lots of fresh stuff, desserts, breads, meats, cheeses. I had a sandwich and it was perfect. My previous visit was for dinner with a medium sized group and the food and service were fantastic! I'll happily drive an hour to get there. Worth it!

I had only been in the deli and market before. 
The restaurant is very nice. I really like the look of it. The booths are very comfortable. 
They start you out with delicious crusty Italian bread, with a tasty olive spread. That alone will keep me coming back. 
My husband enjoyed his frutti de mare. There was not a morsel of food left in his plate. My friend had  the stuffed rigatoni. She said the flavor was the best she has had in a very long time.
I had the special. The Pecchari. I liked it it was just a little under seasoned. 
We were too full for desserts. 
We stopped in the deli and picked up some items, including the olive spread. 
We will be back here, beautiful place, great service, good prices. Very good food.

I've been here so many times for reverse happy hour and I always have a great experience. The food is so delicious. My favorites are the shrimp scampi and the meatballs. I enjoy the live music, I think it's a great addition to the experience.

Went there again today, ordered an Sicilian sandwich and it was great! I was excited when they told me they had rainbow cookies again (since they are my fav) and now I'm left disappointed again, the cookies are dry and hard not the way cookies should be! I spent $7 on a bag of cookies that I just threw in the trash!

I go there on Thursdays to see my friends perform. Thursday is the day to go if you love to see cool, Jazzy music! Lots of local musicians show up to jam ( myself included sometimes). The owner is a bit " Gloomy" ,  certainly not the friendliest guy in the world, but the music and the vibe is really cool. Happy hour is awesome as well! $ 7 Beef Carpaccio? Can' t beat that folks!

A very nice itialian restaurant off the strip in Las Vegas. Two of us stopped for dinner with no reservations on a Tuesday evening around 7:00. No trouble getting a table. 

The wine list had lots of recognizable choices but I picked an unknown Malbec. Good choice. 

Started out with some bread and pesto spread. Both excellent. 

I ordered Gnocchi in pesto sauce. The pasta was cooked properly and the sauce was tasty and was served at the right temperature. 

Live music was playing in the bar and we could here it in the dining area. Good thing it was jazz!  



Great place and well worth a visit.

Our waitress was very professional. Our water glasses were never past half empty, and she checked on us often.

Stopped in for an early dinner/Happy hour in the lounge. We've been here before and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves as we did during this visit. The service was spectacular! Our server (Liliya) knew the wine list as well as the menu items. The Rigatoni Bolognese was fantastic/flavorful. The spaghetti and meatballs were delicious and plentiful. I'm not much for describing food but I know what I like and this was very good. 

The lounge is very open and friendly with plenty of seating at and around the bar. The deli is fun to visit and have lunch with an attached wine room. The dining room is spacious and has a warm feel to it off of the kitchen.

This stand alone Trattoris and Deli (not in a strip mall) is well worth the visit as the food is interesting and the service top notch.

Very nice bar area & dining room. The deli was nice also pick'd up some goodies for later in the week~
   Started off with prosciutto & mozzarella very pretty presentation and quite tasty too! Followed up with a really salad of baby greens, walnuts, apples & blue cheese. Very nice light champagne vinegar dressing . 
    Ordered pizza  which was good, but not great~thin crust which was nice, topped with olives, artichoke hearts &  proscuitto. The sauce was not to flavorful~ 
   Out server was nice & attentive. SUMMERLIN is a bit far for us, however if in the area I would DEFINATLY try Sienna again and go for the pasta

I attended the Italian Car show again. WOW !  Amazing Cars and Incredible Tasting Food. How's that for a 2 team Parlay ! The place was packed. Ferraris, Maseratis & Lamborghinis everywhere. Throw in purrfect weather and it was an Excellent afternoon. 

1st class job by Siena as usual. Can't wait for next years Show. Grazie

I came here very excited.  I had been wanting to try this place for  forever. We were greeted by a wonderful older gentleman. Who sat us and was our server  He made us feel like family the whole time.  5 star service.  The food was excellent.  My sister got the lasagna and I ordered the chicken marsala.  She said the lasagna was excellent and I thought the chicken Marcella was fantastic as well. Our server made me feel very confident about what I had ordered because his eyes rolled up and he said that it's amazing and that he would actually have that for lunch himself that day as well.  The service was very attentive, the food was excellent  the decore is excellent ,the vibe is excellent and I would definitely go back here again.  After we were finished we went to the deli side of the restaurant and ordered sandwiches and desserts and meats to go. I have tried a little bit of all of them in again excellent quality.  The Sicilian sandwich is one to order and also the tiramisu is no joke.

Horrible service, the band was ok, but I ordered clams with tomato sauce it was terrible, the clams were bad they smelled old and uncleared they took off the bill when I sent it back. The wine was also really cheap. No Bueno

Our first time here. Excellent service and delicious food. Will definitely come back! Most everything on their menu is homemade which always makes it better. Want to come back just for appetizers and desserts so we can try more things. Can't wait to eat here again and we haven't even left!

The food at Siena is its strong point, and the service is always stellar. Love the lasagna, especially, but everything's good. The only fault I can find is the live music. It's a tad too loud, and not especially good. Luckily, you can sit outside! Great bread. Great cocktails. Great salads. A very enjoyable culinary experience, but the live music has got to go. It's the only reason we wouldn't go again (in the winter it'll be too cold to sit inside!). Love this joint!
Becoming a favorite spot. The penne a la vodka without meat is my favorite. Good salads and drinks. Great brunch menu, the stuffed avacado was perfect and the bottomless mimosas are great.

I had no idea they had a nicer resaurant side and a deli & bakery on another. Now that I do, I will be stopping in more for lunch. I always see the parking lot packed with cars when driving by so my wife and I decided to check it out. 

The deli & bakery side has glass cases of breads, cakes, cookies etc. I originally wanted a sausage sandwich (the sausage is made fresh at the restaurant) but they were out for the day so we ordered a meatball and Sicilian sandwich. Both were good and affordable. The meatball sandwich was cheesy and the sauce had a good taste. I don't know how many meatballs are supposed to come on it but they weren't shy with them at all. The Sicilian sandwich had a lot of flavor for not looking like much. There was either an Italian dressing or maybe oil and vinegar on it but whatever it was I liked it. The bread on the sandwiches was good but I picked out a loaf of bread from the bakery and it wasn't as soft and fresh tasting as I hoped for. I will pick out a different kind next time and give it a try. Good to know there is another solid sandwich in town.

Went to check out the recent remodel with friends for happy hour on a Friday evening.  The food was delicious as usual, but the service was atrocious. We had two equally  poor waitresses.  In fact, it was bad enough that we were embarrassed to have chosen Siena as the place to treat our friends that evening.  With so many wonderful choices within a 10-minute drive, I'm afraid that was our last visit.  The bar was pretty dead for a Friday night, too so I suspect others have been driven away as well.  How sad, because the remodel is beautiful.

I like this place. I havent been here in a long while, but it is easy to get to especially if you live in Summerlin. They have a great happy hour, and the food is good. Sinatra plays in the background and it feels like little Italy. But don't think for a minute that this is trendy place for that go elsewhere.  

The bar is lined with old lonely men who have come here to reminisce of days long gone. Most of the patrons look and dress like they belong in retirement communities in Florida or Sun City. 

The atmosphere is nice, people are pleasant...and the staff is great.

Siena is sooo amazing! Atmosphere and decoration on the inside is beautiful! First you get a bread basket with olive tapenade which is sooo good. I ended up getting the fruitti de mare and it was absolutely amazing. The seafood was cooked perfectly, their sauce was delicious, and I believe they used fresh pasta too, and that just put it over the top! We also had this dessert, I can't remember what it's called but it's like an almond cake with white chocolate and that was reaaally good as well. Will be back!!

Two of us ordered pastas.. I loved the pasta I ordered with tomato creamy sauce. Both were good tasting and good portion.. They have piano & bass live-music.. It's a good place to have a small date.. The service was just fine.. They have Happy Hour menu too (approx. $7-$10) but it's not as valuable as other restaurants' such as Yardhouse or Kona Grill..
Authentic Italian food.The Pork belly and roasted rosemary chicken are so good!! I totally recommend it.
We enjoyed a lovely dinner for two.  Was the best Alfredo Sauce I tasted.  Service was professional.  We will be back

I went to Siena with a party of 12 for Happy Hour.  If you want to be drench with ice cold water by a busboy filling your water glass, not receiving your change when you pay your bill because the waitress assumes it's her tip and not honoring the eclub coupon, than this is the place for you.  The happy hour bar food was average but prices not so happy.  I can't recommend this restaurant at this time.

We went here for dinner a couple of weeks ago and had a really lovely dinner.  Very authentic and fantastic service.  My husband had the Ravioli and I had the Penna ala Vodka.  Both amazing choices.  I also loved that I asked the waitress for a wine recommendation based on what we had a taste for and she came up with an affordable complimentary wine choice.  Would definitely go back and recommend it for anyone looking for a GREAT italian meal!

I come here every tue night for karaoke drinks n dinner with a group of 5-10 people regularly. I happen to eat raw...so I asked for sliced tomatoes as a app. I was originally charged $13 for a caprese salad...5 slices of un-ripe tomatoes slices. I threw a fit..so they changed it to $7. The server didnt know how to make a long island and only seemed to care about racking up the bill and her tip. They lost my business!  John Carlo...that is cheep low business practice to over-charge. Keep return customers happy..or they don't return. An entire veal canoli cost $8....so did 5 tomatoe slices. Reduliculous!
I'd say food is slightly above average...staff is fantastic. Ambiance is great.  LOVE that they have live music in the bar.  We love to watch STEF n Rock.

Stopped in a few days ago for a sandwich. They have a good selection of imported and domestic goods.  
My husband and I ate BIG fans of an Italian deli in southern California so we decided to check this place out to see if they're any good. 
Now we're both biased so I suppose our expectations were super high, nonetheless I ordered a mortadella (imported) sandwich and although it wasn't exactly what I was hoping it did satisfy my Italian deli sandwich craving.  

They do not have po'boys or godmothers or any of that but if you know what's in any of those Italian sandwiches I'm positive they can hook it up. 

All in all I'm going to come back and give this place another go. I did like the friendly customer service.

Sfogliatella, Italian pastry perfection!

You know you have a VERY good friend when they share snacks like this with YOU!  Especially when these beautiful tasty morsels are no where to be found within 2,500 miles.  My girlfriend from Naples LOVES these treats...but she is so loving and giving that she shared the only one in her possession, (which her most wonderful husband hauled all the way back from California) with me. We sat there and split it, did not speak as we licked our fingers until every crumb was gone.  We just stared at our empty plates with despair.  Knowing we would never be able to eat this again for months, maybe years to come.  We started planning a trip to Italy, which can't come soon enough!

I don't usually get a sweet unless I can share it.  If I have to choose between dessert and a glass of wine when it comes to calories, wine usually wins.  But this treat is not too sweet, it's just simply amazing.

Fast forward to this morning...Siena, half restaurant, half bakery/deli, in Summerlin.
We arrive mid morning to find the case empty!  OMG, shouldn't have stayed out so late last night, we missed it!!!  Why couldn't we get here earlier?!  So many reasons, too many to count...at any rate sadness turns into happiness as soon as I explain my despair to Fabio.  He tells me wait 30 minutes, he will bake more!
Really?!?! Of course we will wait.  I'd wait all day for this amazing creation. 

Walking around their take out gourmet food section could easily take half an hour!  Salami, cheese, prosciutto sampling cut to perfection.  The couple at the table next to us, from Milan, happily sharing their pistachio mortadella and piping hot baguette with us!Exactly 30 minutes later...voila!
Fabio returns with lattes,  cappuccino's and 4 piping hot sfogliatella's!!!  6 more made to bake at home to go! All magically appeared and disappeared all within one hour of being in this authentic Italian bakery/deli. 
I have to pinch myself to see if I was dreaming.  This pastry was done to perfection!  Not sweet, cream filled, flaky, hot, crispy and ooohh soooo gooood with the strong Italian espresso.  Just what we needed.

If only I could only learn to make these little wonders at home.  I ask Fabio to explain...his hands fly up in the air!  Much too difficult!

My favorite place in town for calamari! 
They also have an awesome happy hour and some really great wines.
We love to go in for drinks and a few apps.
Dinner is somewhat expensive but if you're not on a budget, this is a great Italian restaurant. 
Sit at the bar for awesome service!

We were at Village Square for an early afternoon movie and wanted to meet friends for dinner close by. They recommended Siena Italian. It is literally around the corner and was an excellent choice. Our server, Sebastian, came to our table almost immediately take a drink orders. We were early enough for happy hour so I went with draft beer ($3.75). For my entr√©e, I ordered one of their specials, a lobster tail with shrimp and scallops and  black ink pasta. Always risky to order a lobster tail in a restaurant that doesn't specialize in seafood but I love black ink pasta so I thought I'd give it a try. Great choice! The lobster tail was succulent. The shrimp and scallops were fresh and tasty. And black ink pasta was absolutely delicious. My wife went with a salad and the happy hour baby lamb chops. Also excellent choices. I definitely will return the next time I am at the Village Square theater around dinner time.

Been a lot of time on the bar here in sienna deli but we went with some friends for a late dinner and what a surprise we had! The full menu was unbelievable, we started with cheese plate with Italian verity of cheese was great then calamari and an arugula salad. Save the best for last the branzino fish was unbelievable probably the best deal in town was so tasty. The live band on Friday was great and the service was supreme. Definitely will go back and recommend to go and try this place.
Food was great and out server Sebastian was amazing!!!

Saturday we went to the bar for a few beers plus fried calamari and crab cakes. The bar was empty except for a small group of regulars. The bartender ignored us for a while. He finally took our order. Got our beers. It took forever to get his attention so we could order our food. It finally came. I again had to get his attention to ask for a basket of bread. Then the same thing to get some butter. Then had to flag him down to get another beer for each of us. My husband finished his 2nd beer. The bartender took away the empty bottle, but never asked if he wanted another. We had to flag him down again get another beer. He finally came back and took our empty plates. He then immediately gave us our bill! He never even asked if I wanted another beer! The vibe of the place was very strange. The bartender had a dead pan expression that never changed. He stayed at the far end of the bar the whole time. Only checked on the regulars once in a whole to see if anyone wanted another drink. During our stay, a man walked up to the bar and was furious because he was at a table in the bar area with friends, but even though they saw them there, no one came over to wait on them. The service was unfriendly and awful. The food was not good at all. We will not be back.

Love this place! Cloth napkins, white tablecloths, servers know every detail of the menu and it's ingredients. Lots of choices and everything I've ever ordered was delicious. Since I don't eat meat, they are very accommodating on substitutions. Go early, it gets very busy and noise level escalates. Happy hour: 4:00 - 7:00 with some great appetizers on their happy hour menu. 
East side of restaurant is their deli. Get a custom made sandwich for lunch tomorrow or a pastry for breakfast!
Absolutely love this restaurant! Live music is great and the food is yummy (=

This place is awesome. 

We moved here from the NY and NJ and coming here was like being home. 

Delicious food, very nice owners and employees. We were so pleased and look forward to many shopping trips here.

Wonderful outdoor seating in beautiful Summerlin!!
SUPER GOOD!!!

We used a Yelp Coupon, which we were told is for the restaurant side only, but they would let us use in the deli.

Dinner consisted of 2 Italian Sandwiches (Under $7?!?!?!?!?!?!), juices and a shared slice of cake. (We also had an over priced, not too good piece of lasagna - $10?!?!. But I am not going to hold that against the place)

The women behind the counter were very helpful and friendly.
The cakes... OMG, the cakes!!! We had the Mocha, Chocolate Coffee Cake.

Siena is prime to become out new stop for sandwiches and meats.
They have an interesting wine selection and a comfortable set up... TRY IT!!
Bad experience night before thanksgiving. Car got keyed by front door. Credit card info swiped. And worse of all, osso bucco bad.

Las Vegas has roughly 5000 delis- this is one of the best.

Half of the building is an upscale restaurant and half is a grocery/deli you can dine in- immediately turn to your right upon entering to to to this section. The other half is basically for upscale dinner-quality dates.

The bakery-deli-grocery has everything you could possibly need from fresh pastas to calamari salad to real canned peeled San Marzano tomatoes for kitchen adventures and more marinated artichokes, olives, and peppers than you can shake a stick at.

Order at the back counter for takeout or dine-in: the first sandwich listed on the "hot" page is what you want to get. It's a chicken cutlet with spinach, fresh cheese, and God only knows what else, and it's frickin' amazing.
Runner up is the Sicilian sandwich, the first listed on the "cold" page, with ham, Genoa, and mortadella with mozzarella- get it with everything on it. Fresh crunchy veggies, complementary spices and oil, and the freshest and most flavorful meats and cheeses I've yet encountered.  Both sandwiches are made with the freshest, most delightful french roll bread. Oh, and they're frickin' huge. Like half of a single sandwich is an entire meal, huge.

If that's not enough for you, there are two cases of desserts and the service is phenomenal- be sure to get the guy with the thick black-framed glasses, he's delightful! And they have both regular happy hours (3-7PM, daily) and reverse (Mon, Tues, Thurs, 9PM to close) with half price drinks and apps.

I have been eating at Seina Deli for about 20 years, the food is always perfect, the service is always perfect. The Deli makes in my opinion the best sandwiches in Vegas. The restaurant next door is top notch also. My only problem with the place is they moved. :( working at the airport, I can't run over there a get lunch anymore. Now I have to drive to the other side of town.

Authentic Italian style sandwiches and deli. I could eat here every day. Only complaint is that it is a bit pricy. My place in Los Angeles was much less expensive. But if you want a great Italian sandwich in Vegas this is the only place to eat.

Went this evening for dinner with my boyfriend, our 5 year old daughter, and a friend. We checked out the deli first before dinner. It reminded me of my favorite deli back home with all the fresh meats, cheeses, pastas, and desserts. AH-MAZING!  We then headed into the restaurant and were seated right away. Our server was professional, friendly, and attentive (I think her name was Gloria). Food was awesome! We ordered calamari, a small Caesar salad, rigatoni bolognese, fettucine alfredo, a cheese pizza for our daughter, and some crazy pasta with scallops, lobster, and shrimp. Everything tasted fresh with the right amount of seasoning, and it was all hot! We were expecting to pay around $13 for the pizza as that was the price listed on the menu, but were very surprised to see our server only charged $5 for a kids pizza. Thanks!  We then went to the deli and ordered desserts to take home. We just finished dessert and everything was (surprise) delicious! 
Everything was fantastic and we'll definitely be back!

The food is delicious with a lot of selection I don't normally see at Italian restaurants. The waiters are such characters. The tapenade they give you with bread is heavenly. The atmosphere feels high end but it's reasonably priced. I haven't had a single thing here I don't like. The only negative: they use styrofoam. I really wish they would adopt a more eco friendly option for their containers.

I am writing this review to thank the staff for giving my daughter and her friends an amazing dinner for their Senior Prom.  

With large group of 12 they were having a hard time deciding where to go for dinner.  Others in the group had suggested going to  Brio but my daughter wanted to make her senior prom the most special one yet.  I had been to Siena a few years ago so I took her to check it out.  She LOVED it!!  It really took some convincing of her friends but she really wanted to get her way....she wasn't going anywhere else but here.

They all had a great time.  She said the staff was so great.  The checks were all split up as needed with no problems, they never had to ask for refills and the ambiance was beautiful.  She said everyone loved their orders with one exception.  The vodka sauce, calamari, other seafood dishes were amazing, but the the lasagna was the only dish that wasn't loved.  

I had been nervous sending a large group of teenagers to a nice restaurant.  I was afraid they wouldn't be treated as well as maybe a group of adults would.  I am so pleased that this was not the case!  

Thank you thank you thank you!!
Great sangria . Loved it . The food is well cooked and delicious. I love the food and drinks . The service was kind of slow but the employees were still wonderful and nice .

This is what Las Vegas needs!!! Leave the supermarket mozzarella and macaroni salad, this place is the real deal!!!! Stop in for an espresso or full on shopping for dinner!! Where do I begin with this place!!! You can get lunch to go, the most amazing pizza squares or sammies, while your there pick up frozen tortellini and sauce and real Parmesan cheese for dinner. Not to mention fresh baked Italian bread every day. I cannot say enough how amazing this place is. Stop in on yore way home, take eastern instead of the freeway, and pick dinner up at the GEM of a place. I love going in and picking up real pasta and tomatoes from Italy, and getting a scoop of gelato and stuff for dinner. I always find something fantastic on the shelves that I must have and will always go back for a taste of real Italy and a friendly family counter experience!!! GO TO SIENNA!!!!!!
Unbelievably delicious. Home made pasta and sauce. Good service, atmosphere, good entertainment. A+ I recommend to many friends and look forward to going back.

Disappointed. We have been going to Siena for a few years, but the last 2 times have not been a positive experience. A week ago we went for happy hour, used to love it, but the old guy bartender is horribly slow. We cringe every time we go in and see him working. He got a little busy (not full bar busy) and it was forever for my husband to get a 2nd glass of wine, I tried and my glass was empty for 20 minutes we finally asked for the check...3 times, then had to wait and wait and wait. A couple sat for a half hour waiting to cash out, he held their card, and they had no choice but to wait. I had to ask how long we had to wait before we walked out with out paying, it was that bad. 
Tonight we went in for dessert and ordered a full tiramisu. It was made with whipped cream. Not just whipped cream on top, all throughout the cake. Being Italian you know better. It was greasy whipped cream, meaning not fresh homemade whip cream, but the stuff you pipe out of a bag made with hydrogenated oil. Come on Siena Step it up, I know you are better than this (hence the 2 star rating). I've experienced it. Do not cut corners, it just cuts your customers. We won't be back for a long long time.

Stopped for dinner here after driving in from California. Felt like a good Pasta dinner and this
place looked good. We got a chopped salad that was excellent and Lasagna which was super good and The Healthy Choice which was whole wheat angel hair pasta, with fresh tomatoes and sun dried in a marinara sauce that was also good, once it was replaced as they first brought out whole grain spaghetti and I was told they were out of the whole grain angel hair pasta so replaced it with whole grain spaghetti and I said no way I ordered angel hair pasta that is my favorite and after talking to the manager they replaced it with regular angel hair pasta which was ok. They comped us a dessert which helped.
Definitely an older crowd and not to kid friendly.
Spent 98 dollars on sliced meat for an event I was hosting and they didn't even bother taking the casing off half of the meat

I love to hear the Goodfellas on Thursday night but putting up with the rude bartender try's on my nerves. It's not only his rudeness but he short changes you and when you try to point it out to him he walk away. It not the first the this has happened but many many times. Also the prices during happy hour aren't very happy.

No you're not in Brooklyn your in the desert.  It's mostly all here in a boring strip mall - the older cashier from Sicily, the large selection of olive oil, the homemade cannoli, and the other Italian items one would expect.  

It's like getting a big hug from your tough Italian Aunt.

The Goods
1. Bakery and deli on one side with small Italian grocery store.  This place came highly recommended by a friend especially the frutti di mare.  They are known for Italian desserts.  
2. I loved the bread basket, as I usually do, with the tapenade it is like crack in spread form!!
3. Bruschetta was a little soggy from the tomatoes.  The bread could have been a bit more toasty
4. I had the best best white zin here - Bel Arbor from California.  Usually I don't get anything out of a glass of wine but this one definitely had a taste of grapefruit, and I finally finished a glass of wine.  
5. Entree didn't have the best presentation but the piccata sauce was delicious nicely tangy.  
6. Desserts are Italian favorites!  I got the sampler 

Service
1. Server was great!!!  
2. Front desk and bakery was less friendly.  
3. I felt like it was harsh, maybe this is Italian style 

Ambiance
1. Ambiance in other photos mainly showed the deli but the sit down restaurant is more sleek and modern
2. See photos 

MoJo
1. Try everything!  I wanted to try the sfogliatella, but they were fresh out :(

Had friends from out of town who wanted to eat Italian.   We came here and the atmosphere was great.  We had appetizers, salad, entrees and dessert.   The food was great.  The service was excellent.  We were allowed to relax and enjoy our meal.   One side is a bar and the other is the restaurant.  When we were leaving I noticed they had live music in the bar.  This is a great local bar and restaurant.   We will definitely be back.   I loved everything I ate.

Iced tea is good. Not rancid as in when they do not clean the container
Bread is suboptimal. Plenty of olive oil and balsamic plus olive dip. But bread is not fresh or of quality. This ruined most of the first impression. Don't understand why compromise on the first impression to a costumer. 
Cannelloni from the lunch menu does not say anything. Sauce is mediocre and meat made me think of frozen packaged food. 
Overall experience: great atmosphere, franchise food.
We happened onto this restaurant tonight and we have found our Italian restaurant here in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere, amazing food, and excellent service. We will be going back regularly.

This is the first time that we visited this restaurant and it will be the last time. My date and I sat there for 10 minutes and no one came to even offer us water. A waiter that had been standing there the whole time had the audacity to say goodbye to us after observing us leaving the restaurant.  No one seems to care. How sad we picked this place for a date night.
Still wonderful food! Make sure you go during happy hour as their bottles of wine are half price. We just had lobster ravioli and it was to die for!

Went there on Easter Sunday. The place was empty and we we were immediately seated. It took the server, Jaime, a good 3-4 minutes to even acknowledge us and then the same amount of time to bring us our soft drinks. The food was good and a great value. I was extremely thirsty and asked if he could leave the H2O pitcher on the table since I did not want to wait for refills. He left the pitcher and within a couple minutes he came and took it saying his manager would not allow this. 

The food comes and just prior to making room on the table for the plates he coughs into his hand and then moves my silverware. I asked if he was out of his mind and gave me a blank look. I asked him to wash his hands prior to placing the plates and to secure me new utensils. 

This place needs to put the guest needs first rather than removing the water pitcher and teach the staff proper food handling skills.

The new Siena on West Sahara is decorated nicely but the food is bland and just average AND the service is terrible. The blond, older woman bartender brought us the menu with an icy stare and unfriendly demeanor. And acted as if she'd never seen us before while she asked for our I.D.'s (even though we've been in there 4 times recently) every time we've been in when she was working she always has an attitude. They used to have a nice, younger bartender working but we don't know what happened to her.

 The restaurant is new and not very busy. I would think that if they plan on staying in business they'd want that old crank to change her attitude or get out from behind the bar. I've been a bartender for 4 yrs and would never dream of acting like her while I'm working. 

We've decided not to go back.
Very nice restaurant, good service. Steak was smaller and the vegetables bit more for me. Compatible with UnionPay card, which was nice.

Great atmosphere and exceptional server (Gail) earned the stars. We didn't care for the food and for the quality we thought it was very expensive. Party of four, no appetizers, no drinks - $100.  We've paid much more at other places and raved about the cuisine.  Siena was mediocre at best. We were there around 5:30 on a Wednesday evening so we didn't get to experience the live music. That probably would have earned them another star. Doubtful we'll return. Too many other wonderful restaurants in Summerlin that offer much more for much less.

This review is for the deli and market.
OMG! Can't believe this has been under my nose for so long.
This is...by far...the best Italian deli/market in town!
Excellent selection of meats and cheeses which were sliced and packaged with great care and patience. Awesome cookies and market has everything you could think of to prepare a great meal!
Haven't tried their restaurant but I assure you-this has now become my go to market!!!

I remember the scene in goodfellas at the end:
" Can't even get decent food. Right after I got here, I ordered some spaghetti with marinara sauce and I got egg noodles and ketchup.

Not to mention their albino manager is the lacking all people skills, sarcasm is not a talent!
Haven't been here for over 2 years. Dinner tonight was terrible: no flavor at all. With all these good Italian restaurants around the Summerlin area, I don't see how this restaurant is in business.

Amazing service! Alex and Todd are both excellent and Gian Carlo, the on site owner really cares about his restaurant. I stopped by tonight and heard Jack Walker singing, it added to the already awesome food and ambiance. Would highly recommend! Date night, girls night out, whatever - it's a should be on your must-try list!
Went for a birthday party and had a good time. The staff was attentive and courteous. They handled our small (roughly 10-12) party well.

Another awesome review for Siena.  I've been going there for years, and in those years I have never had a disappointing experience.  The character of the place, first of all, is fantastic.  The deli counter is lively and bustling, the market area, although small, is crammed full of interesting goodies that beg to be taken home and placed in your pantry, and the dining area with the red and white tablecloths all lend the place a homey feel - if your home happens to be Italy or even Little Italy.  The breads up front always tempt me with their fresh, crusty look and the cheese selection is dynamite, outta sight.

Their lasagna is absolutely heavenly, their Sicilian pizza wins over everything else in town that tries to come close, and the garlic knots will make you unkissable for days but you won't even care because they're that tasty.  Their deli salads are all superb, apparently even the calamari salad. (I am not touching that with a ten foot pole though.)   The most amazing, splendiferous thing about Siena?  They are awesome, honest, just-plain-good people.  One day I lost my wallet there and spent hours panicking.  I called Siena and they hadn't seen it until later in the day someone was sweeping by the register and my wallet had been kicked under the cabinet that holds it.  They found my business card inside and called me at work.  My wallet was returned to me, all eight measly dollars, ATM cards, and identification accounted for.  Visit them NOW, they will rock your socks off.

Haven't been to the restaurant but the deli is top-notch with fresh sliced italian meats. Always great service and great sandwiches. Kids love the spaghetti & meatballs too! They also have a really nice Italian market.

Food was delicious, too bad it wasn't what I ordered.  We waited way too long for the food to arrive, and was not going to wait another 1/2 hour.   

We ordered grilled octopus that never made it to the table.  So I can't tell you how it tasted.
One of my favorite places for Happy Hour here in Summerlin! Staff is friendly and the HH prices can not be beat! PLUS, HH lasts ALL.DAY.LONG on Sundays #signmeup

We came here for dinner with friends and enjoyed a nice relaxing meal.  We started with some antipasto, the Buongustaio and the plate was plenty for the 5 of us.  Then we ordered our entrees,  We had the Cacciatore pizza with sausage, special pasta of the day, little pillows, salmon alla griglia (salmon with spinach), Zuppa Reale, a delish spicy Italian bouillabaisse with seafood and a tasty broth, and I ordered the Tagliolini ai fruitti di mare.  Tasty bread and bread chips were served before our dinner arrived.  My frutti di mare was flavorful and plentiful.

This review is for the deli and bar area, not the main dining restaurant. 

The Deli's service is mediocre at best. However, the food is great. At the deli, I've had the Siena sandwich, sausage and peppers sandwich, and the prosciutto sandwich; bruschetta, tiramisu, gelato, and latte. All the food has been really good. 

My favorite is the sausage and peppers sandwich. Marinara sauce + sausage + peppers + onions = ONE AMAZING SANDWICH!!

Latte's are strong and very flavorful coffee. 

There are lots of Italian-type merchandise products for sale. Olives, pasta, olive oil, sauce, peppers, and etc. 

The dining area has very nice interior, but I've never eaten there before. I've had a drink at the bar area. On a Thursday night, the bar was almost completely full. 

Tuesday-Sunday's have live bands from 8-close. 

Happy hr is from 3-7 everyday; reverse hh from 9-close; happy hour all day Sunday.

I visited Siena on Tuesday with a bridal shower party of 16. The private room we were given was beautiful, but that was the end to the perks of the restaurant. The bread service had pita chips and bread with an olive tapenade. It comes in ramekins that hold 1 tablespoon of tapenade, and given to share among 4 people. So, we were pretty much all able to have 1 slice of bread with tapenade on it. Wonderful!

We split an aragula salad which was actually very tasty. It had figs and some tasty cheese, but a tad too much dressing. That was the best part of my meal. My mother-in-law next to me ordered the penne (I think) and the pasta looked homemade. I suppose that's the one up-side of this place. Several of the pasta dishes looked like it was homemade pasta, but me, wanting to be healthy, opted for something low-carb.
