When it came to ordering, I opted for the salmon with a side of asparagus (4 stalks). My friend next to me ordered the same thing, and we were both incredibly disappointed. The salmon looks like it was butterflied in half so that we each got about 3 oz. of salmon that was incredibly thin. Mine was over-cooked to say the least, but hers was burned. The whole outside was black and charred... Unfortunately, the salmon which came highly praised by the waiter (whom I only saw one time when he took my order), was so small that I ended up starving and eating a bunch of bread just to fill up. So much for low carb. 

Since our party was so large, there was an automatic 20% gratuity attached onto it, which would be fine, if I ever got a refill on my water glass. I was so thirsty, I almost drank my friend's water. Sorry, but I will never be back. I think most of the people at my table shared this sentiment. My total for half a of a salad, very poorly cooked, thin salmon, and 4 stalks of asparagus with 20% gratuity was $36. I think I could have purchased a weeks worth of wild salmon and cooked it better myself.

Good food. Poor service.  Under staffed during lunch.  Servers are trying their best to take care of too many people. Bar was unmanned for the majority of the time I was there.
Simply put... poorly managed

We love this restaurant because of the service and authenticity of the food.  The recipes are true Italian and nicely plated. I love the eggplant parmigiana and linguine with clams. Desserts are nicely sized for sharing.  Definitely a location for a special occasion.  Live music in the bar on certain nights adds a nice touch.
I really like their food. Beautiful restrooms. Our waitress Gloria was great. We will be back!

I love this restaurant the staff is always wonderful the food is good most of the time every now and then you get really mushy pasta they have to remember to keep it al dente. Delicious wine selection and Wednesday nights they have an 80s cover band that is really fun and not too loud so you can enjoy the company of your family as well as music. The penne vodka is out of this world
Everything was wonderful! The food is outstanding as was the service! They have live music as well.

This is only my second time to this restaurant but I really enjoy the atmosphere. All the staff are super friendly and the food is excellent. I live fairly close so it's really convenient and the neighboring shopping district is excellent as well. I had the ravioli and honestly it's probably some of the best I've ever had. The reason I didn't get five stars is that parking can be a bit crowded. There's just not enough space to get a nice car parked in here.

Gotta say, I wasn't to please with this place. 

Annoyances:

Waitress went to seat us [since there was a non existent host] I said booth please (they had one waiting to be cleaned). She rolled her eyes and said well it's going to take 5 minutes or so, I said, " That is fine, I can wait."  She wasn't pleased. 

Lucky me she really was our waitress. *eye roll*. She rushed everything, [wasn't that busy, might have had (4)4-tops that were being used as deuces, save one that happened to be an actual 4 people.  Then I asked if the calamari had tentacles in it, said I didn't want it if it didn't, she said yes, plenty. Out it comes with 1. I'm not kidding 1. What in the name of calamari is that, you said plenty! 

Then she seemed upset we asked for wine and then more bread. I asked for more bread because the calamari sauce was bland, the lasagna I ordered lacked flavor as well (next day it tasted a bit better in microwave) and well, her crappy attitude was making me lose my appetite. 

I tipped her 15% because I can't go less and told myself I will come back another day and see if it's any better!

This used to be Bertolinis and the decor has not changed much.  I have eaten here with family on two busy Friday nights.  The service was great and the food was even better.  Our waitress worked quickly to correct an incorrect order being given to our table and the manager was very apologetic. The live music in the bar ranges from good oldies to more recent tunes and the manager can be found walking around to be sure all is running smooth.  Great for families or couples.

I love this place the food is good, ask for easy sauce on all pastas though. A bit dissapointed with not seeing my regular boys Todd and Todd - it seems theres been some staff changes. Appies and mains are great - but never had an amazing dessert.

Great Italian restaurant. Wonderful food! I would have rated this a 5 star but my waitress brought me the wrong order. Even tho the dish was excellent i would have loved to try what I ordered. Its very elegant inside and the wine is delish! Seating is great.

Came again and had some delicious dinner. Seafood tasted amazing.  

We'll be back.  Sad to see that there isn't any more dancing :(.

Haven't been here in years and not sure if I will soon. 
Upon entry hostess seemed to have s shitty attitude it was like " oh excuse me for walking in your restaurant". 
Service staff is pretty good I guess lucky and didn't get the waitress with attitude from another review. 

As for the food, well nothing to hit home about. Chopped salad was so-so, eggplant was like someone shaved it really fine to make slices. Sauce was just bland, tasted like any other place or Olive Garden 

Rather go to Marc's down the street or Paymons  for pasta

This has been my favorite Italian deli in Las Vegas since I have lived here.  The recent transition in ownership in the past few years had made it even better.  The quality of the food is still excellent, but they have really cleaned the place up and made it more enjoyable to stay and eat in a clean environment.

Favorites include the Siena sandwich (chicken, spinach sauteed in garlic and oil, provolone), the Italian or Sicilian sandwich, their pizza, and their antipasto - all of it is excellent.  Desserts are also great too - cannoli, gelato, etc...

Even had the pleasure of taking my family on our last visit and they had a lively older gentleman there who was playing the accordian and telling some great stories.

Well worth a visit, and a great variety of deli options here.

I will have to update this review after I dine at their restaurant, because I'm only able to review the deli and market side of Siena.  

First off, Siena Deli is in the heart of the shopping center on Tropicana and Eastern and offers a real deal Italian ravioli's, cheese, and delicacies.

Nice place! Food was very nice and the service was very good. Will go back again and try something else on the menu. I had the whole stripped bass and it was amazing. The best part of this place are the homemade cannoli's made to order. Wow!

Great selection of meat and Italian products here. 

If you're ever in the mood for a mortadella sandwich, this is a great place to go, and it's also in the same block as Settebello, an authentic pizzeria (VPN).

We get our deli meats here regularly and would recommend it to anyone looking for genuine Italian fare.

Absolute nasty.....red headed waitress forgot my iced tea, free bread sucked, it wasn't fresh...i ordered some new soup they had NASTY...of all the years at eating at Italian restaurants this place is GROSE AND SERVICE SUCKS..

This is one of the best Italian places in Vegas. The food was great, and a great atmosphere to go along with it. It's a little on the fancy side but not too fancy. I'd say a step up from Olive Garden, but not so fancy that your paying extra for a side of meat balls, and another side of broccoli. All in all it is a great place, and food was delicious.

Wow! I'm really impressed with the happy hour. Okay prices, slowish "Euro" style service, but this place literally has about a 70% Italian staff. 

The food was tasty, the drinks were good, the ambiance was amazing. I'll be back!

Incredible!! My wife and I are so glad that Siena has come to the west side! We used to drive to the other end of town to shop at Siena's market and get a slice of pizza or some ravioli, now they're right in our backyard! 

  We were there this last Friday night for a birthday party and were fortunate enough to sample a number of dishes we hadn't ordered on previous visits. First and foremost on our last visit was the gnocchi with basil pesto. The gnocchi is far lighter than at most restaurants and the basil pesto was perfect. The pizza was also exellent! Thin, crisp crust made with double zero flour and charred to perfection. The antipasto platter is a great starter for any meal. Our meal ended with my favorite dessert, tiramisu and port! 

  Chef Giancarlo spent a great deal of time with us and made sure we all had a great time and an excellent meal. He even broke into his private stash of Lemoncello and had an after dinner drink with us. There aren't many places where the owner/ chef spend the time with the patrons that Chef Giancarlo does at Siena. If you like great Italian food and an all around cool spot, Siena is it!

  BTW, the wine list is great and priced right.

Took two good friends for a birthday celebration and they didn't disappoint. Our server (we're pretty sure it was Tom) was brilliant from the apps through the main course to the dessert. He had great suggestions, up sells, and was on top of beverages even after a party of 12 came in. Food was incredible and the portions were huge. We'll definitely be back for another evening.
I have been to Siena several times.  They have a great happy hour menu in the bar.  Service has always been great, bartenders and servers alike very friendly and professional.

Their deli meats are imported, top notch quality & will make your mouth water if you're used to Italian home made cooking. I'm from Rhode Island we're all either Italian or Portuguese & this place reminds me of home.

The Deli on the side of the Italian restaurant is quaint and resemble an authentic Italian deli. The cold cut sandwiches are excellent and the orzo and chicken soup was right on the money. No frills here, just good authentic Italian meats and cheeses that make the sandwiches out of this world. A must try.

Second time here. Service was poor. It's the night of the Mayweather fight and we're 1 of 3 tables in the place. Couldn't get a refill on water unless I specifically asked. I ordered a medium well sirloin and it came out black. As in charred and burnt. I had to ask to send it back because the server tried to pretend not to see it. When I sent it back the sirloin that replaced it was medium rare (blood was coming out of it). At that point I was too hungry to care and ate it. Overall the food has been good and this was the first time something hadn't been well (no pun intended), but the way the server handled us really didn't sit well.
Have enjoyed the food, Entertainment , and Friendly faces for years . Now I live closer I hope to be there for every Salsa Saturday. Thanks for having such a warm wonderful place for a warm drink .
The quality of the food in the restaurant seems to have decreased.  Maybe this is just a momentary thing? Will again in a month or two. They have a wonderful deli

A deli a true deli! I get pizza and cookies for the kids as we paruse the aisles getting the stuff you cannot get anywhere else. Sadly the Albertsons next door closed making it a special trip when I go, but worth it when I do. Excellent food , dessert, meats and cheeses. I love to get the garlic knots, prob the best thing ever. Trying to snag a man but can't cook ladies? Make a quick swing in and grab a few "homecooked" items and next thing you know yer pickin out curtains!

Food was very good and the prices very reasonable.  Lowered the stars because our server looked like she had just gotten out of bed, her hair was all over the place and she smelled like booze.  We had to ask for drink refills.

Giancarlo has done an amazing job expanding the restaurant, the menu, the deli - don't miss the most fantastic Italian food in Las Vegas!  Enjoy 1/2 price happy hour specials paired with live entertainment, a casual meal, a special occasion - or take out.  All of his breads, pastries and sausages are homemade on premises!  Schedule your holiday parties here and now; or allow them to cater your next event.  Buon Apetito!

We went early on Saturday  night, I had a taste for bouillabaisse. First, I ordered a calamari appetizer, it was hot but very tough.   When  the soup arrived, I was truly disappointed. The stock was poor, the calamari was tough, it was bland overall. The waiter did not ask how I liked my food. Overall, it was an experience I won't be repeating. What's the deal here? They want you to think this is a good restaurant and serve lousy food with indifferent service. Too bad, I loved the place over on the east side.
This is an authentic Italian deli and restaurant. I'm married to an Italian beauty and she loved it so much we went back twice.

I haven't written a review in a while but, I felt compelled to do so now. FYI- I visited the deli not the actual restaurant part. 

My step son gave us a gift card for Christmas and I finally decided to use it. Here it goes;
 
I was weakly greeted upon entering. 
I told them I had never been there before blah blah. I called my husband to see what he wanted. I was going to get the meatball Parmesan but, when j asked if it was good the girl said " if you like meat and cheese yes". Obviously, if I was inquiring about it duh. Anyway, I changed my order to the Sicilian (which my husband ordered while I was on the phone getting his order in front of the girl worker). I asked for no ham. We discussed it for a minute or so. I took a look around prices seem high. I ordered a coffee it was very good. They use  Lavazza Italian coffee. ( so. ?). 

The kid rings up my order. I sit and wait for my food about ten more minutes and I'm thinking " God, this is taking long". I ask "is my foot ready"? Oh it was ready when you paid for it . I'm starving n I'm sitting here waiting. Really? Then, I look in the bag and I have one sandwich not two. Wtf? To be honest I would have rather gone to subway. I'll use the gift card to buy coffee there and make it at home.

Really good Deli For italia. Lovers!
Restaurant is great too and if you need catering service JAkie is always helping out!
Good place to hang out!

We had some of the best service here than we have had in a very long time. 

This place is great for us because it is right across the street. We ordered a calzone, cheese ravioli, and a spicy sausage pasta. All of them, were excellent. The calzone was light and fluffy so it didn't weigh you down much. The ravioli had crispy sage and brown butter. And the sausage pasta was spicy, and a good sized portion. With two glasses of wine, and dessert, our bill for three people was $80. A bit on the higher end but it was nothing considering the flavor and service. We will definitely be back.

I used to be a fan of the deli, but not anymore. While the food is good, the service is just idiotic and completely disrespectful. You'll wait at the counter for 15 minutes while 3 employees ignore you and are too busy catching up on their tasks, forgetting that a customer is not a disturbance, but the reason for their job. 
A bad experience could turn into a positive one with one and only small gesture: Let me know it will take a while or take 1 minute to take my order, so that I know you're not just wasting my time. What makes other's order so much more important than mine that you cannot even talk to me???

This is not the first time that this happened... it just gets worse each time... enough to scratch it off my list of good places. I'll just go down the street a few blocks to Roma Deli instead.

Ive tried to like this place, really! Ive put in a solid effort but time after time I'm just so disappointed. 

1st time- I sat at the bar for lunch. After waiting almost 15 minutes for the bartender to show up, I ordered a glass of Cab and the Carpaccio. The carpaccio came out 20 minutes later, and it was room temperature. Now after working in Italian restaurants for most of my life I know carpaccio is supposed to be cold, due to being raw meat. When i confronted the bartender about this all she said was "that's how its served here" I ordered another glass of wine and didn't touch my meal. When i got the bill i noticed i was charged for two glasses of Merlot. at $16 each & she didn't take the carpaccio off my bill even though it was untouched and I voiced my concern about it. 
When I asked her why the Merlot she said "Oh well that's what i poured you, and you drank it" I laughed paid the bill and vowed to never return.

2nd time- Firefly was too busy and my friends all talked me into giving this place another try so I did. It was a disaster. Bartender obviously had friends at the bar so we were ignored the majority of the time, and when we got our bill their were drinks on their that were obviously not ours... but couldn't help but notice the bartenders friends were drinking what was on our bill. Nice dude.. real nice.

3rd time- Came in here last night for the live music. And once again... 100% pure disappointment. We were seating in the lounge area and it was absolutely impossible to get service. The little Russian server was not only rude but we kept having to go up to the bartender for drinks because she was no where to be found.

All i have left to say now is... 3 STRIKES YOUR OUT.
Awesome Italian Deli with so many choices! Beautiful desserts made by their very own pastry chef. Clean, fast and friendly service. I love this place!

I'm having trouble putting into words the fantastic experience that just happened in my mouth. I had the spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken was perfectly flavored, perfectly tender and perfectly crispy. The garlic aioli was just the right amount of spicy. Then, add the crisp just right tomato and thick slice of cold mozzarella. This sandwich phenomenally delicious! And the steamed multi color potatoes were the perfect side to this sandwich. New favorite lunch spot? Maybe so!

Not what I expected at all.... had the bruschetta for an appetizer... hardest bread ever and the toppings were equally as bad and completely tasteless... service was marginal... our waitress actually could benefit by having her hair tied back...  probably needs to listen to the customer...food came and seemed overdone... everyone at the table had issues with the taste and doneness of their food... was looking forward to a Saturday night dinner with friends... I would totally suggest you spend your money elsewhere...

Food like your mama makes...if your mama is Italian! The calabrese is the bomb. The cavateli, the best I ever had! Great bakery too!

So why 4 instead of 5 stars? The side salads are pathetic. C'mon guys? Why insult us with such  lackluster, tasteless, bits of lettuce? If you're going to serve a side salad, make it worthwhile, or don't serve it at all.

Also, the Italian sandwich is perfection at Cugina's. The one here is good, but somehow doesn't hit every note like Cugino's.

But back to the good....best take out! And uh...the cookies! You must get cookies!

Second time at this restaurant great atmosphere lovely staff! For mine and my fianc√©'s meal wine dessert and coffee came out to be $130 which is super cheap i totally forgot the name of my dinner it was a NY Steak though which was so good it did not need any salt or pepper the fruit tart was probably the best I've had yet. Oh and you have to order the calamari when you go it is nice and crispy some restaurants that I've been to there calamari is soggy and tastes under cooked so I was happy this one was not like that! The wine was light bodied and amazing paired nicely with the steak and my fianc√© said that the cappuccino here was the best he's every had !
Giancarlo is always a gracious host and the meal fantastico. Tante Grazie! Do not hesitate going to enjoy a fine meal and ambiance.

I really enjoyed this place. I also used the Yelp deal buy $10 for $20. 

The restaurant has real charm with outdoor tables and a live band.  The ambiance inside is cozy. 

Service was top notch! Our server was very patient as we mulled over the specials and menu. We enjoyed the Calamari w/ a great marinara! The sauce is so good, you want to drink it!  We ordered a Cannelloni special and Cavatelli Con Salsiccia - Spicy sausage pasta dish. The pasta was homemade and al dente. Sausage tasted like a meatball. It was really tasty. We also ordered the Italian Black Forest cake for dessert, went great w/coffee. 

We tipped the band and used our yelp deal to conclude a wonderful evening.  It's a great place to sit and enjoy dinner. I look forward to coming back every weekend!
The restaurant was absolutely lovely to eat at. Both the quality of service and food was stupendous! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for top quality and authentic cuisine.

I wanted to 4 star this place. In my head on the way there I was thinking its going to be awesome. It just wasn't the case.  If they had any competition here in Vegas, this would be 2 stars. I just wasn't Wowed. The cold salad case looked days old. I mean they didn't even turn the stuff over. Uugghh. Not good. The desserts looked OK but nothing spectacular. I was surprised the didn't have Boars Head meat. I ordered a slice of Sicilian pizza and wasn't impressed. It wasn't horrible but Ive had better pizza here (and mine is made from sauce from fresh tomatoes and homemade dough).  I just wasn't all warm and fuzzy like I wanted to be. If you are looking for pinwheel sausage they have that here. But I don't eat sausage so it does me no good but for you sausage lovers looking for that maybe its good! The service was ok and price for Sicilian slice was $3+ (not bad!). I don't think I'll be back though.

This review is for the bar area.

Dang, this place sure is pricey but tasty. If you want to enjoy the place without breaking the bank, order an appetizer and keep eating the free bread they offer.

I ended up ordering the shrimp scampi, but I wish I went with the meatball sliders. They looked much more filling. But in general, the appetizer portions are small. 

That being said, the food is good and nicely presented. The service was pretty good, too. When I have more money to spare, I will definitely come back.

We came here for a family dinner and while it wasn't a complete disaster, it wasn't good enough to warrant a return visit. The wife's raviolis were probably frozen because the insides were still cold. The presentation of my lasagna was nice -- sitting in a little sauce pan -- but the sauce was a little bland and there wasn't much meat in the lasagna. 

They don't have a kids menu but they suggested a slice of pizza from their deli instead of a regular sized pizza. We thought it was a good idea since he doesn't eat much, but after seeing the quality of the "pizza" they brought out we regretted the decision. First of all, they forgot the order and we had to remind them. It finally arrived well after the wife and I got our meals. What they brought out was a square pizza that looked like it was made that morning or earlier. They just tossed some cheese on top and reheated it. The quality of it was awful.

We did flag down a manager and voiced our concerns. She was nice enough and apologized, even taking the pizza off the check. They offered to comp dessert but we declined.

The restaurant was packed with plenty of older Summerlin folk. That's neither a compliment nor a condemnation, just an observation. It may be popular with some people, but not with us.

This review is for the deli.

I had been wanting to try this place and was surprised to find out they have a deli and restaurant! From the front of the building, the deli is on the right and the restaurant is on the left. 

I ordered a "Sicilian Sandwich" priced at $6.99 and a "Meatball Parmigiana Sandwich" also priced at $6.99 for hubby since he was lost looking at the bread loaves they had for sale. The girl behind the counter gave me a receipt and said I needed to pay the girl at the front. Heading towards the front I noticed some yummy looking desserts and decided to get a slice of "Pecan Cheesecake" priced at $4 per slice. Hubby picked out a focaccia loaf that cost $1.90 and we were set. 

The Sicilian sandwich was really good! It didn't look like there was much to it, but it packed a lot of flavor. Half way through our sandwiches, hubby and I decided to switch and the meatball sandwich was cheesy, delicious and something I would order again, but I liked mine better. I had the pecan cheesecake later for dessert and it was much better than other places around put out. The focaccia loaf however wasn't fresh. To be fair, we did come in just after 8 pm, so the bread was maybe baked earlier in the day, but they should mark the baked goods down after a certain point. I enjoyed the sandwiches and dessert enough to return! 

Inside was clean and the employees were very friendly and helpful.

I didn't know I was in the mood for Italian until we got here! Keep in mind, this review is for the restaurant not the deli. From the moment we walked in & greeted by the Hostess, we were having fun! The Hostess was very warm, welcoming & funny. Our Server was quick, prompt & very pleasant. As for the food, the calamari was delicious, the lasagna was great! My Partner ordered the Surf & Turf, and he felt it was just ok however the Mushroom tortellini that came with it was delish! They have a great wine storage in the middle of the  restaurant that acts as a divider to the deli.
Really good italian food. Good service.  No chicken parm on menu but they made it for me. Can you say 5 stars on seamless?

We went here for Valentines Day. The outside of this place looks very nice, once you walk in it has more of a "Cheap restaurant chain" feel to it. Once we sat down the first thing we noticed was this think white paper covering the table cloth. Almost like construction paper thick, I felt like I was back in grade school sitting in the lunch room. We had looked at the menu online before we went to make sure we knew what we wanted. They had a "special" Valentine's Day menu, on this menu everything was about $10 more than the menu they had online. They brought us out some bread and a spread, which was very good. We asked for some oil and cheese to go with it. They literally brought us an open bottle of olive oil and a plate of shredded cheese.... never seen anything like this before. I ended ordering the lasagna and my girlfriend ordered the tomahawk pork chop. The portions were pretty small, but the food was good. It this place worked a little more on presentation of itself and its staff it would have gotten a better review from me. Until then, I'll look for another Italian place to get me pasta fix.

This is re the deli.   I'm disappointed because I needed thick ricotta and dry ricotta...I called ahead and was told they had both.  I drove across town.. the dry ricotta was too salty and they wouldn't cut in chunks only slices so I couldn't shred it.  I bought the wet ricotta though it looked too wet only because the girl told me that's what they use.  It was way too wet...in fact wetter than the store bought type...but it waa fresh...hiwever it had zero flavor..it was like eating nothing.  I wanted it to make fresh from scratch raviolis but instead used v I t bin a ricotta cake where I could add flavor and the wetness didn't matter.  I don't appreciate that they wasted my time and the questions I posed to both girls...well they were both clueless about italian supplies and cooking.   It's a shame
Wasted time and money.
Excellent Italian, with deli attached.  Currently they have live music Wednesday nights and Sunday Brunch. It is a ways away from the strip (which is nice).

Have never eaten at this restaurant before. Was invited by friends and was very pleasantly surprised. We had Cacciatore Pizza and it was wonderful!
Very tasty, service was great and the price was right. Will be back for sure!!!

Good food.  Great Ambiance.  Poor Service ( I put up with it! )  Seems as if they never have experienced servers!  Do recommend however,
 just expect okay service.

This is our "go to" spot for a weekend lunch.  It's like an old Italian deli you'd find in Chicago or Highwood, IL.  Everything is fresh, homemade (oh, that bread!), sausages, pizza, the sandwiches, hot or cold,  are amazing, and the desserts are incredible.  They even have a wide variety of olives.  They have a deli side and a more upscale dining experience in their restaurant located next to the deli.  We love eating our sandwiches on the their covered porch.  Very relaxing and inviting.  Love this place!!
Had such an amazing night! The live music was really nice. The service was outstanding and the food and drinks were delicious! Felt very welcomed here will definitely be coming back!
Best Happy Hour food in the city plus live music at times. I am there for lunch a few times a week in the private room. They have a big heart, great food and the most amazing deli.

I went in the afternoon of Sunday 4/29. The two women behind the deli counter were about as useless of a pair I have ever seen. There was one piece of Reggiano in the case. A corner cut that had been passed over by everyone else. The lady would not cut me another piece. The cashier acted like she was deaf. The sausage I bought was rotten and I had to throw it away and go out again to another store. Okay for dry good imports but be weary of everything else.

So first off, the only side of this 2 sided joint I am reviewing is the deli side, I have not dined in the main dining room as of yet.

This is a great place that my wife and I go to for fresh deli sandwiches. 

The service is always quick and pleasant every time I venture in here. All of the meats and cheeses are fresh making the selection of sandwich variations endless and very good.

The pasta salad and the cucumber are our favorite sides and a great refreshing add on during the hot summer months.

Hopefully I will be able to return and sample the dining side to update this review fully.
Very delightful, restaurant was very good, good service, we even went into the market and took home some dessert and some Manhattan Specials, they need to make some Black and White cookies though

Was craving a sub and saw all the Sicilian sub pictures on here so I decided to give it a try. 

Siena's is a nice restaurant with a deli attached to the side. I was really surprised by the selection of food at the deli. There was also gelato and lots of cold foods but I played it safe and went with the Sicilian. Cashier was was very friendly and the service was fast. 

I would probably give this sub a 4/5. It was a delicious sub but I've had better. The bread was really good and it wasn't messy like other subs that I've had that are just prone to falling apart. 

I just really love that there's a freaking deli attached to this restaurant! I was expecting the sandwich to be pricey but it wasn't bad ($7.50 including tax). This may be my new place to go when I get the munchies while studying at the Sahara library.

This place is off in the corner of Renaissance Plaza.  It's a small little deli located inside an Italian grocery market.  I'm giving it an ok rating because I didn't experience the best tasting food at the time.  I got an Italian sandwich.  The bread was a bit big, and the bread was a bit stale like it should be with that type of bread, but it cut the roof of my mouth.  The sandwich wasn't anything great in particular.  The stuffed calamari didn't really smell right, and it was cold when I ate it.  I took it to school, but there wasn't a microwave around so I had to eat it like that.  Not sure if it was supposed to be like that anyways.  The food is an ok price.  The worker was very friendly, but when I asked what was good, the only response was that "it's all good."   Haha I understand that, but usually I need a bit more help than that.  I'm going to give it another try and hopefully my second time around will be a bit better.
Great service by Josh and team!!! Quality food at great happy hour prices, a hidden gem!!!!

Lately I've been visiting local Italian restaurants and Siena was previously on my bookmarked but I haven't got the chance to try this place out. Until my most recent visit with my family, because it was my parents 36th wedding anniversary. They wanted something new to try out oppose to the norm and being Filipino my parents are biased to Asian cuisine. However, we decided to try this place out and was pleasantly surprised how delicious the food is. I do appreciate how spacious the restaurant is with 3 separate sections with the bar/lounge to the left once you enter. There is a main dinning room in the middle that had an intimate and modern appeal with a cool looking see-through wine room. Then to the far right side is the quick deli and market with imported Italian food.

Based on our dinner and service. My family and I were impress with the awesome service. Order was taken in a timely manner and came out according to our preference with appetizers to the main courses. The bruschetta was a favorite of ours, especially the fresh diced tomatoes and sauce even the texture of the bread was consistent without being too soggy or crispy. Calamari was breaded just right! So far appetizers were on point. All of our dishes was made just right with Frutti De Mari prepared to our expectations. This was the favorite among the dishes we had including my lasagna order. Layered with equal amounts of meat and cheese and was cooked well without being overcooked and runny. Onto to the desserts, the family got 3 different items: Lemon Ricatta Cheesecake, Tiramisu and Cannoli. The Cannoli was a hit with our party because it was fresh and had a balanced sweetness an airy crisp texture. Will need to come back! Overall we had wonderful time for my parents Anniversary. Special shoutout to the staff, "Grazie Mille!" :)

2018 Yelp Review #40
Hadn't been here in years - beautiful new decor ! Food much better too and good service . Wish lunch special prices were less and we would lunch there more !

So me and the wife went there on a Friday night for dinner. It was kind of late and the place was empty except for the bar area.

So we got seated the waiter came over took out drink order, got the drinks asked about the soups and was told that the soup we ordered had no meat on it got the soup and what do you know it had pork in it asked the waiter and his response was I didn't know there was any meat in there. Ok I know it happens once in a while so he took back the soup and got a different soup which had no meat in it.

On the main entree since it was late we decided to share the steak dish. The waiter takes our order not asking how we want it cooked. Steak comes out looks good and that was about it. Had the first piece which was chewy as gum. Then  took the knife to the second piece and the rest of it was so rare that it was purple inside. Called the waiter over and notified him about this tells us ok I will put it back on the grill to cook a little more. Wow! What put it back on the grill! After we touched it. We were both appalled at this so we asked for the manager.

Manager comes over tell her what the waiter was going to do and just side tracked and said oh we can get you a new dish. No I'm sorry, no the waiter said that by mistake! Nothing. Don't want to know what goes on in that kitchen!

By that time I was already turned off told her just give us the damn check!

One star in for the soup and salad we had otherwise no stars for this place!

This place is CUT!

Amazing fettucine, melt in your mouth noodles, creamy Alfredo sauce, excellent service, definitely recommend a visit, you won't be disappointed! Plus they are current with the times- i.e. wifi, yelp deals, opentable, etc.

5 Stars isn't enough to tell you how impressed I was with this restaurant.... I LOVED it. GO THERE NOW!

Ok, so I see that they've got eggplant parm sandwiches & I think, "Wow, that sounds good". But it wasn't. I wouldn't serve it to my family & I'm sure they wouldn't serve it to theirs.

I was tasty, but it was basically a marinara sandwich. They start with paper thin slices of eggplant & bread it on both sides more than tripling it's thickness. A few slices of that & a negligible amount of cheese & they call it am eggplant parm sandwich.

Not for nothin' you guys but I think Broadway Pizza on Rancho makes a much better sandwich!

This place has the best pesto gnocchi I've ever had, for a very reasonable price. Both the pesto and gnocchi are homemade there! I recently went to another Italian place with the same dish that was twice as much and not as good. I'll be coming back just for this dish!

The food was good but rather blah.  Service however left a lot to be desired.  We ordered 5 different appetizers to try the menu and had to ask for fresh plates with each serving and were never given clean utensils.  We won't be back.  The prosciutto though was *awesome* and we will going to the Deli to buy some.
I enjoy eating at the bar. The food is good but not great. Had some pasta and it was very good. Bartenders very attentive and a nice over 40 crowd. Great place to grab a quick bite and socialize.

The first time I went to Siena it was absolutely amazing. So much so that we talked about the food many times between December and this visit. I came in to town to visit family and this place was number 1 on my to visit list. We dined in on a Thursday evening. It wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. The best thing I had that evening was the appetizer of different cured meats and cheeses. It is $24 so a bit expensive, but we shared it among 4 people. You can tell everything is fresh cut and it was just delicious. The other appetizer we shared were the mussels. In December, the mussels were amazing, buttery, and no fishy taste at all. This time not so much. We couldn't even finish them they were so fishy. It was a disappointment for sure. For our entrees I got the linguini with clams. Again, very disappointed. The clams were full of sand and the sauce had absolutely no taste. What a bummer. I was really looking forward to this meal and it just didn't deliver. I am hoping it was an off night for them. I will be back again and hopefully have a similar experience to my December visit. If you do go, splurge for the cured meat platter. It really is worth it.

I was recently given this restaurant by a local in the Summerlin area as a must try for Italian. They have an Italian market and bakery attached to the restaurant and make their own bread and deserts.

I opted for an early dinner (Happy Hour time frame). I sat in the bar area and ordered a full meal. The bar was very large and there were about 16 people in the bar area enjoying their happy hour cocktails (40% off) and appetizer specials.

The Spicy fried calamari was a bit over fried. To me, it seemed as if it was frozen and fried out of the box. There was NO spice at all and the marinara that was served with it also had no spice. This dish could definitely use some work. 

The Italian Antipasto was exactly as expected. Fresh cured meats, cheese's, etc. 

The chicken marsala was very light and well prepared. The mashed potatoes were not too desirable but decent. I think a nice risotto would be a better accompaniment than the "american" mashed potato. 

The lasagna, my specialty being Italian, was a good portion but a dish full of sheets of pasta. Nice pasta but way too many layers with almost nothing in-between the sheets of pasta. I touch of fresh sliced basil across the top would have given a fresh pop to the dish. 

I will come back and try another dish or two but I will not do the lasagna or calamari again. 

Cannoli made fresh. Comes with chocolate chips. Didn't seem to have an option. I prefer options like almonds instead of chocolate chips. But, that is just me. The shell was done to perfection and the ricotta chocolate chip center was creamed just right. You must like chocolate and appreciate a perfectly cooked cannoli shell for this desert. It is a must try if you are a cannoli person.

The service was wonderful. Kind, polite, attentive and very helpful.

If you are looking for a good happy hour with a crowd in their early 60's on up this is your spot. Everyone at the bar seemed to be locals and enjoying each others company.

Siena is a prefectly ok suburban italian restaurant.  Service is usually very good and the atmosphere is nice.  The food can be spotty.  The bruscetta would benefit from less quantity, more quality.  I've had it a couple times and the tomatoes lack flavor.  The bread is also pre-toasted and then left to sit.  For entrees i've had veal with mushrooms.  It was pretty good but nothing too memorable.  The pastas are good (you can buy many of the ingredients at their store next to the restaurant).  Espresso is good.  Worth a visit if you're stuck on that side of town.

This review is for the deli only.  I wanted to make something different for family that was staying with us.  My neighbor recommends this place highly so I gave it a try.

I bought some boxes of frozen stuffed shells made in house and a container of their house made marinara sauce.  The result when I baked the shells was very good.  I took a look at the other frozen pastas they have, and while the price seems higher than supermarkets. I think the quality is higher.

Service was just OK.  Even though it was an hour before closing and no one else was in the store, I had to wait to ask a question until the two young guys on duty finished the conversation they were having.  After looking at me, one of them turned back to his co-worker and continued the conversation.  I was going to give the deli 4 stars, but I deducted one for the lackadaiscal service.
Love the store!  They had plenty of frozen gnocchi for sale.  Tasty & saved me time!  Bread is awesome, too!

We were out in Summerlin for biz, and we happened to stop by Siena in a strip mall.  Its on Sahara near Fort Apache.

I started off w/ a small ruchetta salad w/ arugula & figs ($6).  For my main, I had an ortolana pizza w/ eggplant & asparagus ($14).  Siena offers a lot of sandwiches, salads, pastas and pizzas.  In addition, they have a deli adjacent to the restaurant.

First of all, the salad was very good.  You don't often see figs in a salad, and the sweetness contrasted well against the peppery taste of the arugula:  4 Stars.  On the other hand, the pizza was just OK.  The toppings were tasty, but the crust lacked any character.  In addition, the toppings weren't evenly distributed, and there wasn't enough to cover each slice:  3 Stars. 

Our waiter Tracy was very good.  He was friendly, attentive and on top of things.  Any special requests were filled quickly:  4 Stars.

Likewise, the ambiance is nice.  There is a large bar area to your left as you enter.  The main dining room is straight ahead, and the deli is to the right.  A nice feature in the dining room is a large wine display separating it from the deli:  4 Stars.

If you find yourself in the area, bag the rec for Nacho Daddy across the small side street.  Siena has very good food at reasonable prices, and the service & ambiance to match.  Plus 7% cash back w/ Yelp checkin and your credit card linked to your account.

I was reluctant to give 5 stars to this wonderful deli... not because they didn't deserve it, but because I didn't want my first two reviews to be a 1 star and a 5 star. It looks like I am one extreme or the other -- but I was so impressed with this authentic Italian deli that 5 stars it is. Here's my story:
I was hopping from one yard sale to the next with a friend when she wanted to take me to lunch. She asked if I had ever been to Sienna Deli, and I said that I never even heard of it. It was decided that I had to try their Italian Combo sandwich.
Not quite a restaurant, this is more of an Italian Market than anything else. The deli counters are stocked full of meats and cheeses and more varieties of olives than I knew existed. There are rows of shelves stocked with grocery items -- presumably all imported directly from Italy. Sienna also features a dining area inside and an additional outside patio for diners.
We ordered our sandwiches at the counter (Italian Combos) and were given a number card to take to our table. The food is delivered by a waiter; thus it is not fast food in my opinion. The sandwich was warm from the oven with flavorful fresh bread that was toasted to a crisp crunch! Generously layered with ham, salami and cheeses I consider this to be truly authentic cooking. On the table were olive oil, balsamic vinegar (my favorite) and assorted condiments to suit anyone's taste.
The food was great... excellent even! I would recommend stopping in for lunch when you are in the neighborhood, as you will not be disappointed.
As for the shelves stocked with Italian groceries, that is another story. I find it difficult to pay $3.79 for a can of tomatoes, especially when the exact same item is available at the 99 cent only store. Though the grocery prices were close to four times the available price I decided I was reviewing the food, thus the five star rating. My final thought is this: If you are planning on sitting out on the patio for lunch you might want to reconsider. It looks like it has been a long time since the tables and chairs were hosed down. Eat inside.

AAAAAhhhhhhMAZING!!!!!!!!!
so yummy we went there everyday we were in vegas except on sunday cause they are closed.
Best cannoli I've ever had!
best meatball sub....and I kinda consider myself to be a bit of a meatball sub connoisseur. However the homemade sausage pepper and onions sandwich defiantly rivaled the meatball.
my brother really like their ravilois and the sicilian sandwich.
great market with authentic italian fare.
friendly service, fast and CHEAP!!!!!!
sooooo good I want them to move to SF.

We were out shopping and decided to stop in for dinner. Not realizing we needed a reservation, we were seated after a ten minute wait. Not the greatest table, close to the kitchen, but the food and service made up for it. The food is excellent and there are so many wonderful choices. We will be returning again, but this time with a reservation.

Good hoagies, good selection of Italian stuff not easily accessible in LV.  Staff is OK, not the friendliest not mean either.  I will continue to go back.  They basically charge extra for everything you add to a hoagie that they don't put on themselves.

As I'm reading all these reviews - one thing stands out. We are ALL COMPLAINING ABOUT THE SERVICE. I'm sure a manager or owner reads these (maybe they don't and that's the problem) but do something in regards to training your wait staff! I was so excited to try this place for Mother's Day, my husband surprised me with reservations. As we were seated at the booth in the far back next to the kitchen, the waiter, I didn't catch his name (he was a shorter Italian looking gentleman) came over And took our drink orders. My husband ordered a Coke light ice and I ordered a Coke with lemon. Not that complicated. Somehow our drinks came out with ice from the bottom to the top of the glass, and a lemon. First strike. We then ordered our food which came out in a reasonable amount of time considering it was a holiday. I had lasagna and my husband had the fettuccine Alfredo which was made with fresh pasta and I believe pancetta and it was delicious. We were enjoying our meal, and all of a sudden something on the other side of the wall apparently slipped off and splattered on my shoe. One of the waitresses apologized I believe it was in all of tapenade that spilled. No sign of my waiter at all. We finished our meal and I then asked to see a dessert menu, and I was excited to see they had sfigatella on the menu. The waiter wasn't sure if they had any left, went over to the deli side to check, left dessert menus on our table. I found that strange. They were all out unfortunately, so I ordered a small dish of hazelnut gelato. He came back over with a different flavor of gelato, not what I ordered. And a trio dessert plate which he left on our table. We didn't order it. At this point my husband and I looked at each other and were wondering what the heck was going on, because there was a dessert sitting at our table not ordered. And my husband joke to that perhaps this was a Mother's Day offering. The waiter then came back over with my hazelnut gelato, took the other one that I didn't order and also took the trio away without apologizing or saying a word. Very odd indeed. I'm so frustrated because I wanted so badly to love this place, it is less than five minutes from my house in the lakes. The whole experience was beyond strange, and that even spoke to the table sitting next to me, and they were complaining that the waiters forgot to put in part of their food order. I have to say the Hispanic woman that was taking care of refilling our drinks was absolutely wonderful, looking back I should've tipped her directly. I really am frustrated, and I do wish that the owners or managers way to train their staff to be more efficient and communicative. I'm on sure if I'll return at this point. We are enjoying our food yes. Was the service Bizzarre? Absolutely. I believe my husband still has the receipt from the restaurant, and if he does, I may be calling the restaurant today because the whole situation was just very odd. We left feeling confused. The food can be fantastic, but if the service is lacking, we most likely won't be returning. And I'm sure for every person that complains about the service publicly, there's 10 or 15 that don't, and simply will not visit your establishment again. Please do something about this.

We hadn't been back to Siena Trattoria for more than a year because last time we were there we weren't really impressed. Today was our 5 year anniversary and we decided to give it another shot. 

First thing I noticed upon entering was that they had undergone a nice remodel! Everything looked fresh and clean with modern cool colors. We chose to sit in the bar area as Happy Hour was going on and we wanted to take advantage of the special pricing. However, it was eerily quiet, as there was no ambient music playing and it was very easy to hear everyone's conversations as the tables are very close together. 

We found a table easily and were greeted quickly by Todd, who was very knowledgeable about the menu and happy hour offerings. We ordered some wine (a pinot noir and nero d'avola which were both delicious and about $6 each on the happy hour) and some appetizers right away. We were quickly and efficiently served water, a bread basket (which comes with a very nice olive tapenade for dipping) and our wine. Our food arrived quickly as well. My boyfriend ordered the beef carpaccio and cannelloni. I had the eggplant parmesan. I am a vegetarian and the happy hour menu was slightly lacking in vegetarian options so I also ordered  a pesto penne primavera from the regular menu. Everything was delicious but the eggplant was simply OUTSTANDING. The best I've ever had. it was thinly sliced and lightly battered and topped with mozzarella and just the right amount of marinara. Being a vegetarian, I've had a lot of eggplant but this was simply the best. The BF really enjoyed his dishes as well and my pasta was quite good also. I think they may have overhauled the menu as well during the remodel as it was way better than I remember from last year. 

The service was excellent, we were offered more wine, our waters refilled and dishes cleared in a timely manner. Everyone was friendly and knowledgable. Our food and wine were incredibly tasty. I docked one star for lack of ambience (no music at all! Not even for background) and I think they are kind of over priced in general but the happy hour pricing makes up for that. I wish we would have had room for dessert, they looked amazing! But we were so full we just settled for espresso which was delightful! 

We will definitely be back! During happy hour of course :)
Great neighborhood Italian place. I always get the Cavatelli Con Salsiccia. Always great service and love the assortment bread they bring out.

First timer, I found out about you on KSHP Radio, what a great meal. Peppercorn steak with mash potatoes and saut√© spinach, I'm not a huge spinach fan but I ate the whole serving. Great service, Great place to have dinner with your family. We will be back soon.

Literally was on the table five minutes after ordering. Seems positive except the food taste about as good as 5 minute food can taste. Simple lemonade taste like flavored water which ranked about the same as for blandness of food.  Should have gone to Buca.
OHMY GOSH IT IS SO GOOD!! My best Italian restaurant from now on! Trust me and come to this place and you will be the winner

My wife and I had dinner here for the first time tonight. I've been wanting to try this place for a while now just because I work for a company that the owner of this restaurant used to own.
To be honest, I read the reviews on here and wasn't expecting to be blown away. I was! This place is a 5 star restaurant with 3 star prices. The food was AMAZINGLY good! I thought it was just me but my wife had the lasagna and said it was the best she ever had! Our waiter was Pasqualie, a heck of a nice guy who really took good care of us.
Then I found out Rod Stewart was coming in to entertain. We didn't stick around for that because I had a long day at work and wanted to go home and relax, but wow! Amazing food and a free Rod Stewart concert? Really? Well worth my trip and I will definitely be back! Good job fellas!

Review of the Deli portion of the location.

I've been frequenting this deli as time goes by. As an East Coast transplant, this place really makes me homesick, by nourishing that part of me which misses all the little Italian delis and bakeries I would find back home. From the assorted bread, to the fresh pasta, the snacks and the hard to find antipasti. The prices are definitely high - you're in a desert oasis and they've imported most stuff from ITALY. So, I splurge here because it's worth it. And if we go often enough maybe the prices will go down. 

My absolute must-haves: biscuits (aka biscotti), pasta (dried, best prices!), cheese (marscapone best price anywhere!), torrone, pizza (literally the best in Summerlin). They even carry great cooking tools like paellas (the pan used for making paella), pasta machines, ravioli cutters, etc. 

When I came upon this place I nearly fainted. I wish the deli would triple in size! My hopes for the future: create a wine section, maybe some on tap, have a bigger pastry selection. All-in-all, love this place and it feels like a hidden gem.

Props to Tetto for helping me out of having to make homemade manicotti this year! Making the handmade crepes takes hours and I just wasn't up to it, but my kids expect it every year! Also, they have sfogliatelle frozen so I can bake them myself! 
I will definitely come back to get all the delicious looking meats and pastas! 
Thanks Tetto!

After living in Las Vegas for a little over four years, and hearing remarkable things about Siena, I took some out-of-town guests there for dinner last night and had a less than desirable experience. I'm not a typical restaurant complainer, but with a restaurant as well known and regarded as this one, I simply expected better.

Let me start out by saying the food (for the most part) was delicious. I will say that they offer a "create your own" cheese plate. The portions of cheese were embarrassingly small. We actually laughed when it came to the table, because I've heard that Siena is known for their cheeses.

Now for the not so good:

First of all, we visited on a Wednesday night and the restaurant was not crowded. Our waiter had to have been new. He mumbled and we could barely understand anything he said. He seemed as though he would have rather been anywhere but there. He took our drink order and about 10 minutes later, returned to let us know the bar was out of one of the flavored vodkas required for the specialty martini featured on their drink menu. We clarified our drink order, and then it took another FIFTEEN minutes to receive our cocktails. We watched them sitting on the bar for most of that fifteen minutes. We had to ask for additional bread several times before receiving it. The service was definitely lacking, and I want to think that this was just a bad night, however, this was our first impression, and will likely be our last here. I was surprised that in a restaurant of this caliber that there was no visible management presence. We never had anyone stop to ask how the evening was going, nor was there anyone visible for us to bring our concerns to.

I hope that the team at Siena can learn from this review in an effort to delight their guests in the future.

This review is for the deli/coffee shop: nice place, good food, horrible service!! I started my order at the register, and halfway through I was told that I had to order my sandwich at the food counter, get a ticket and come back to resume my order and pay at the register (thank you for putting the customer needs first over the employees convenience). Once at the food counter the guy with the rock voice ignored me five minutes, although he saw me; too busy cutting his bread. A younger, nicer but clueless guy finally acknowledged me but messed up my order twice. Back to the register where my coffee was sitting for more than five minutes, and it was not decaf although I said it twice, but the female cashier (consistently horrible throughout many visits) insisted that I didn't. What is wrong with this place??! Not coming back.

This place is great. They have great hot and cold dishes. I had the eggplant parmisan, the cheese ravioli's. They even had delicious deserts that have peanuts on the outside and are chewy on the inside. 

This is also a great little grocery store where you can buy all sorts of staples. The deli looks good, I have been meaning to order some deli meat and prosciutto but have not yet. I will let you know how it is when I do, but this market and deli is amazingly perfect. They are planning to move soon which makes me sad. 

I think the owners are ethnic Italians. They have the Italian channel and sometimes you can even find an old Italian musician playing an accordion and singing from time to time. Truly the coolest Italian place I have found.

Siena Italian Deli-This place is as authentic as it gets..

Fresh sliced REAL Italian meats and cheeses.Fresh made salads and stuffed vegetables and of course pizza,pasta and desserts served on site.

A nice outdoor patio to eat plus indoor seating.

This place gets busy so be patient it's a little pricy but worth it!!

Review is for the store/market part of Siena. 
I used to come here for their great ricotta. Thought it was Polly-O. They have huge gallons of it you can buy. I just picked up a small deli container. Bring it home - its not Polly-O (wat?!?) flavorless, runny and nowhere as good as the ricotta I got from them at their eastside location. Not sure what's up with that, but from now on I'm getting my (Poly-O) ricotta from the Roma deli on Spring Mtn. Also picked up a, $8 ball of mozzarella. No flavor. What's up with the cheese situation here, Siena. Italian and their cheese are supposed to be top notch, no excuses. At least make your own mozzarella in-house. Come on.  

I have ordered their grilled eggplant sammie before (again, from their eastside location) and it was great. Will report back at some point if its still quality on this side of town. 

Overall not too happy with my $$$ purchases from the fresh deli side of the house.
By far my favorite Italian restaurant. It is a bit pricy but every meal is always in point. The portion size is good too. They always take good care of you.

Second time here. The crab cakes were great. Some of the best I've ever had. The pizza was okay nothing special. The calamari was good. Crispy and fresh. The lamb chops were delicious and much better than I expected. The bruschetta was subpar. Don't order it. The antipasti was enjoyable.

We had dinner here on Friday night.  We both had the Marcela chicken, one order was with mashed potatoes and I had mine with Fettuccini noodles both dinners were very good.

There was a singer there to that was very entertaining and made our dinner enjoyable. The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was they didn't offer Shiraz as a wine choice

All in all our experience was very enjoyable and we will return soon.

We came in to Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria starving so when we were welcomed with a bread basket honestly I couldn't wait to dig in. The dip that they served with this bread was so good! I think it was made with black olives (which I'm not usually a fan of) . The dip doesn't look appetizing but looks can be deceiving.  I don't know what else was in this dip but I couldn't stop eating it. I asked for seconds and on a side note the following week I made a special trip to their deli next door and bought more of it! 
I also had some minestrone soup while I was waiting for my entree. The soup was delicious with the fresh grated cheese on top of it. We also had the bruschetta to share. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. I tried their special which was a seafood pasta in a cream sauce. It was good but I really just wanted more bread and dip! 
We ended the meal with their dessert sampler which are regular sized desserts. When we asked the waiter what the choices were he said basically it is whatever they have left over. Our dessert platter came with canolis, cheese cake, tiramisu, and a chocolate mousse. They were so good! 

The restaurant and the deli have a nice ambience. The service was awesome! The waiter is the one who told me that they sell the dip in their deli so he was up there in my book.  I want to go back sooner than later and try more of their menu!

It's a cute little neighborhood Italian spot, and I was always curious about it because the parking lot is always full. The food and service were okay. The bar area is cute and it has a really cute atmosphere. I probably won't go back though.

Being accustomed to all of the great Italian restaurant choices in the Chicago area I was very pleased with our dinner at Siena.  Nice atmosphere, good food and reasonably priced.  I would definitely come again when back in town.

I have had some of the best Italian food ever living near Little Italy in Cleveland, Ohio. Now I have found home here in Las Vegas finally! The Siena Italian Authentic Trattoria and Deli is like visiting Italy itself! Our waiter Todd was very personable and knowledgeable about the menu. His suggestions were top notch and he really helped make the experience the best possible. The spinach salad was so divine, and the deserts were exceptional. But, the pasta was the most amazing thing ever! We each got something different off the menu and we all tasted each others meals... they each were a different type of sauce and pasta and made your taste buds explode with flavor that was just divine and made you want more. I can't wait to go back. Well worth the 20 minute drive from Henderson!

I really enjoyed dinner at Siena. Haven't been in a couple years - but before the name change, I recall coming to Bartoloni's and liking that, too. Siena has a welcoming environment, not too loud, but still lively. The service, I thought, was excellent. Our server was Italian, and I found him to be helpful and gracious, possessing a gentle but wry sense of humor.

The app for the table was a big winner - and a surprise. When you order Calamari, in general, it seems like you're simply trying to please everyone at once - and usually at the expense of something great. Yay to Siena for dispelling that prejudice of mine. The dish was tasty, not greasy, and man, there was an ample amount for several nibblers. I also liked the tomato based sauce - which was a tad spicy.

My glass of white wine was refreshing. The second glass was even better (and seemed a bit larger, lol). It was recommended to me by our server - after I shared my tastes with him. Bullseye. Delish.

The entree was a special: Black Ink Pasta (Sciue Sciue) with shrimp and scallops. Though the red sauce also had some bite to it - it was very different from say, an arrabiata. (And yes, different from the dipping sauce from our appetizer). The Sciue Sciue was hearty, flavorful and I really liked it. Might be nit picking, but i wish there were just a tad more of the accompanying seafood. But, still a good dish that I'd definitely recommend.

I look forward to coming back sometime soon. And someday, coming by their retail store to pick up some pastas, sauces, and more.

The food and atmosphere are both great. Only downside is the price but sometimes you get what you pay for. We shared a pizza, the seafood pasta in cream sauce, and fried calamari. All three were awesome. The pizza was just right- not too heavy, calamari not too greasy, and pasta was delicious. 

We will definitely be back.

We had a great waiter named Ante, from Croatia. Bread basket with Tapenade was very good.
Ordered calamari as appetizer it was hot and crispy, the way we like it,also a very generous portion. Wife had a vegetable strudel and I had fettuccine with meat balls and meat sauce. Could not finish it all, but will eat meatballs for lunch.

This review is for the restaurant!
The decor is pleasant, very nice atmosphere and great service. We ordered the carpaccio which was very good, however, this one had horseradish which makes some bites a bit overwhelming. I ordered the pesce plate and it was horrible! The pieces of fish were lacking flavor. In addition, the fish was charred so i was not a big fan of the flavor. Even the vegetables were not very good! It's hard to write a review for a place that has nice ambiance and great customer service but the food was not up to par.

I stopped by recently for a sandwich.  It was great & the potatoe salad was very good.  The do not take pictures signs are down!   The service was excellent.  The two guys that helped me at the sandwich area and the checkout were very nice.  Yes I will go back. .

They have really delicious sandwiches. I had the Sicilian Sandwich which was good, given the fact it was on fresh baked bread.

Also, they have an enormous selection of imported Italian snacks, pasta, biscotti, olives, and much more. The restaurant side is also great, with white tablecloth service and delicious choice of entrees.

Order Bruscheta and Pasta Promodoro some Prosciutto on the side had two Peroni it was very good. Bartender was very nice didn't get her name thou she must be Asian or Hawaiian it is happy hour and the price is not bad at all highly recommended for some Pasta craving and kill time leisure!

Food was good. The problem was the service. We waited over 30 mins to get our food and we hardly ever saw our server. The manager was great, she did more of the servers work than the server did. Also do not buy any cocktails from the bar because I bought a long island and the bartender stiffed me on the alcohol it tasted like an alcohol free long island. Not sure if I'd say the food was worth waiting for but it (and the manager) were the highlights. I probably wouldn't go back.

Excellent! I took a group to Sienna on Sahara. We had a wonderful waiter Pasquale. He took care of the whole table. The kitchen was a little slow but all the entrees were delicious. The deli and bakery are so nice. Many of my group had never been here and will certainly come again and again.

This place is really good! Definitely one of the better Italian restaurants in town, and certainly one of the most unique. I've been here twice - and I had two totally different experiences, but this place (for the most part) is very well-run, so I'll give it four stars.

The first time I came here was a few Thursdays ago. There was a live band of a bunch of older guys and they were horrifically loud. I actually left the bar and went into the dining room to get away from the awful off-key singing and loud playing. My pasta that night was also a little undercooked, which I was definitely upset about... but the owner came out, apologized and gave a completely new pasta within minutes. 

Once I got my food fixed, I then realized Sienna has some of the best Italian food Vegas has to offer!! (FYI, they also have a deli... I took some cold cuts home with me... YUM!)

If you want my advice, come here on a Wednesday... I came last week and there is a guy singing to karaoke tracks but he is actually a very nice man and a very good singer, and he's not too loud unlike that Thursday night band. Also, it's not too crowded on a Wednesday. That's a plus. He asked me if I had a request which I thought was incredibly nice of him. I'm so sorry I can't remember his name, but I assure you he's a very nice kid.

So yeah, definitely come here on a Wednesday. They also have live music on Friday and Saturday nights, but I haven't tried out the other acts yet. I might give it a shot because their food, I assure you, is excellent.
Consistently yummy and a good value. The wait staff and kitchen can sometimes get behind but the atmosphere and deliciousness that comes to your table makes up for it.

I can't just say anything nice about this place. From the beginning, it gave me an impression that we were not going to enjoy our experience here. I try not to be negative or biased at  but the service here started from horrible to ending just plain terrible. When the server came and got our drink orders he wasn't enthusiastic at all. I don't understand why people are in this industry if they don't like their job. It leaves customers with a negative experience. BUT, for this place it was the server, busser and manager. They were not on the same page at all. After like 10 minutes go by, we finally get our drinks. So, I keep my cool and brush that off to the side. 15 minutes go by, we finally get to order our food. When we order, we wanted a substitution for a dressing since we did not like the ingredient with the dressing that the salad came with. The server  gave us the dirtiest and most disgusted look like what we asked for was just plain wrong. Look, food was decent and thats what gave this restaurant 2 stars. Other than that, service = negative 5 stars. When I read some of the reviews of this place being that service sucked, yeah I still gave it a shot here because it could be just a bad apple. After today, the server, busser and manager, they just want your money and don't care about how you get service. GO EAT AT SOME OTHER ITALIAN JOINT, THIS PLACE IS A WASTE OF YOUR MONEY!

My favorite part of eating here is going to the attached store to buy authentic Italian ingredients. The store has all types of pasta, canned goods, fresh cheeses and meats. You can get prepared foods as well such as slices of pizza and pasta salads. The restaurant has great food as well. I've tried the gnocci with pesto it was very good. The bar also make one of the best Negroni's in town.

So I will just state that we were having an Italian themed wedding. That being said, we were looking for Italian pastries.
We got together with the caterer. She was helpful and pleasant to deal with. 
The day came and everything turned out perfectly. Wedding day was September 12, 2015.
High end Italian restaurant with active lounge and adjoining deli in Summerlin. Large menu, extensive wine menu. Excellent food and service!

The first thing I liked was I walked in and the deli area is amply stocked with lots of various items,it reminded me of a place I always went to in burbank. so I started asking questions about the menu and the gentleman,who I assume was at least a manager or an owner didn't exactly have answers to simple questions,which precipitated an additional extra 5 minutes of uneccesary converstation. I ordered the chicken parm. sandwhich and some Italian wedding soup,I got my dad the spaghetti and meatballs but had them sub in an arrabiatta sauce to kick it up a notch. both of our meals were very good..the soup was excellent. While I was waiting around for the food I inspected the many items they had stocked on their shelves...everything I looked at had past due expiration dates..that's a big deal for me..it indicates a lack of professionalism and selling items less fresh then they should be because they don't want to dump inventory. they could at least discount  the past due items. then there was also an overall blas√© attitude like these guys were still in europe..they were authentic they all spoke Italian but they also had the urgency of italians...slow boat from china.....these are the few items I deducted for...

We went for Saturday lunch with a party of 4 and were seated right away.  The service was fine and the apps were excellent, as was the Caesar salad.  The main issue with this visit was that apparently there was only one chef available, as it took 1 hour from finishing the apps to the arrival of the main courses.  My Pesce misto was flavorless, with the fish very dry.  Other entrees also lacked flavor.

I have been shopping at Sienna Deli when I moved here in the 80's. They were on Trop and Eastern then. The baker, Mike, made the best Italian breads. Now that Sienna moved across town everything has changed. The bread is more French than Italian (the crust makes the difference). We ordered their classic sub which is more like a lettuce sub now. There was no oil, vinegar or mustard on very dry bread. We also ordered cannolis that ended up smothered in a cheap, waxy chocolate syrup which completely ruined them. I tried scraping the chocolate syrup off but it was too sticky. I added my own oil, vinegar and mustard but only one slice of each meat was invisible to the amount of thick bread. What was once a staple in my household is now a distance memory. Not one of the original staff was there (family run business) so I assume they sold it to people who are not Italian.

The cannolis are very disappointing. I expected better from an Italian restaurant / deli.

Feb. 2016 cannoli update: Sadly, I must report that Siena's cannoli are still disappointing. The gal making the cannoli used a huge bag of filling which I suspect comes from an Italian food supply company (Nonna would not have approved). I'm off in search of better cannoli.

The staff and service are always top notch.  My favorites:  caprese salad, pizza and oh my the desserts are delicious!  There is a small deli store attached to the restaurant that is always well stocked and offers a nice selection of goods.  The ambiance is pleasant and there is a dividing wall between the bar area and the main table seating area.  It's casual yet can be a nice "date" location.

Maybe because we had a larger party so tip is automatically included but our waitress wasn't super attentive to us. She was nice but maybe too busy to serve a larger group?  I had to flag her down a couple of times for water. We went for happy hour and our bill was also calculated wrong. 

The food for happy hour was actually pretty good. I loved the calamari and the lamb chops. The lamb chops weren't gamey at all and both portion sizes were great.   Definitely the best out of the dishes we tried. The bruschetta was delicious, crab cakes were ok. A little over fried and not enough crab flavor.   The shrimp scampi needed some more garlic in my opinion but the shrimps were big and juicy.   Their cheese pizza is also not bad as well. The sauce is a little on the sweeter side though. 

I would come here for happy hour again. The food was not bad but don't expect a great culinary experience.

Just disappointed because I showed up on sweat pants , and order plus paid full price food to go, I was ignored by who ever mexican girls name , I spoke 4 languages , hello , ciao , bonjour , buenas noches..... I was just trying to get my dam food not to take her job or even apply for since she is useless .

This is the best italian place I have been to in Vegas. And I don't say this lightly, my wife and I fancy ourselves as Italian food connoisseurs. We have been to several restaurants in the area and this one is the tops. The food is fantastic and so is the service. My wife and I both had the lasagna, because our first time at a new Italian restaurant we always go for the staple. It was perfect, the taste was amazing. I cannot wait to try the other fantastic dishes on the menu. It was my wife's birthday so they gave us a complimentary slice of red velvet cake, which was freaking great. Pasquale was our server and he was fantastic, knowledgeable, and we will definitely ask for him when we return. This was our first of undoubtedly many trips to Siena.
The Sicilian hoagie is worth the extra effort to enjoy lunch at Siena. I never pass up the fresh and delicious sandwich.
Love this place! The restaurant and the Deli. Delicious, unique desserts and coffee. Friendly service.  Reasonable pricing. This is our place to go to whenever we are in the area.

Yes the food is authentic and very good.  Good value for the money too.  Try the homemade gnocchi with the marinara sauce.

I recently had an issue with the food and the manager was rude.

I ordered the NY steak and the gf ordered the sausage spagetti, and both the dishes were terrible.  The gf says that "a homemade spagetti with newmans best sauce"  would have been better.  I can't disagree.  The NY steak smelled and tasted horrible.  They had to slice up the steak, which is a bad sign right away on a piece of meat.  You wonder if it was too tough or in this case since it had some kind of smell, I wondered if the meat was bad.   I took half of it home and when I reheated it, it had a really really strong meat smell.  They also topped it with some kind of cheese, (cheese on steak? )  but anyways, I just thought it was to mask the smell.  

I never rate on establishment, looks, service, etc.  I thought everything was ok.  I go to the restaruant for the food, and what I ordered was lackluster, bad quality and horrid.

never coming here again. ever.

I read a lot of good reviews about the cold cuts.  Maybe thats what I should have ordered. who knows.  But I'm sure not gonna find out.

Edit:  Oh wait, I did like the complimentary bread and the garlic pesto butter.  The shrimp scampi appetizer was okay.  That was standard, until the maincourse  and stinky meat showed itself up.

I have been here a couple of times before during lunch time. I always got the pasta with a creamy garlic sauce and lobster, scallop, and shrimp. I usually get it substituted with angel hair pasta. I also really love the caprese salad. It was my absolute favorite Italian place with the amazing service and food. I raved about it to my husband because I usually came with a friend.
We decided to come in last night for my husband's birthday dinner. He had high hopes for this place because of my description. I came in and I was so disappointed because it was supposed to be special for my husband's birthday.
We were greeted by a friendly young man who graciously led us to a booth and made joke with us. He was incredibly helpful with explaining the special menu. He was the best person on staff tonight. I wish I got his name.
The server, William greeted us by asking us if we wanted to start off with waters. No smile. I told him iced water would be fine for me.
