My husband asked if there was sparkling water so the server said 'okay' and rushed off. He came back with a large bottle of Pelligrino and began to pour in the glass in front of me. I apologized and said the sparkling water was just for my husband. He looked at me as if I was being an inconvenience to him and told the busser 'can you get water for the lady?' And the both of them rushed off. It is fine that there was a misunderstanding but I didn't appreciate how he acted like I was a big inconvenience.
When he came to take our order, we ordered the bruchetta and marinara mussels for our appetizer. My husband ordered the rib eye and I had my usual pasta.
We had finished up our appetizers and 3 people walked by our table multiple times each, not bothering to pick up our plates after we stacked them. We were the only ones on the restaurant side. This usually wouldn't bother me but William's unkind attitude had me in a bit of a sour mood. 
Will brought out our entrees and left. He was not being friendly at all. He put me under the impression that I was being a bother to him when I did not try to cause an issue. He asked us if we wanted dessert and unfortuantely we were too full. I had thanked him and said we were full but the check would be great but he walked away in the middle of talking.
It really made me annoyed because I have always spoke positively about this place but last night's experience was not good.

I have been to Siena twice since they opened in the Lakes. I didn't know much about them and had no idea they had a location anywhere else in Las Vegas. So, I went with a frame of reference based on Italian restaurants and deli's I have eaten at back home in Texas. I took my fiance there for a nice Sunday lunch and at first I was bit intimidated by the atmosphere because it seemed a bit pretentious but once our waiter arrived, he put us at ease. They had different specials and they all sounded so tasty. We ended up getting 2 appetizers-The Burrata and the Buongustaio. I also got an entree -Penne alla Vodka- Prosciutto Sauteed with Vodka in a Creamy Tomato Sauce. I was stuffed beyond belief. My second visit to Siena was again on a Sunday but this time I went into the deli to order a sandwich. Well I ended up ordering The Sicilian Sub and Tomato, Basil, Mozzarella platter doused with olive oil. OMG! This is the food of the God's! Comfort food, but on a higher scale. I wish I could make this food at home but I'm pretty sure it wouldn't turn out the same. That is why I will defer to the experts at Siena. This classic Sicilian cuisine with a relaxed atmosphere and they treat you like you are sitting around the family table. Totally worth the money!

This is the type of find that YELP was invented for.  The type of place you can't wait to review once you get back from your vacation.  The type of Italian restaurant that's worth a 20 or so minute drive off the strip to enjoy the next time I'm in town.  Yes, it's WORTH that inconvenience, providing you already have a car.

I grew up Italian and so it's one of the few foods I'm an expert on.  When you know a cuisine and visit a Italian restaurant, you can -- if you desire -- order the deal breaker dishes.  The men from the boys dishes, if you will.  When they hit the table, you'll know if you've found a gem.  I didn't mean to do this with Siena.  It just sorta happened by accident.  

My partner ordered a sun dried tomato angel hair pasta because she is vegetarian.  Believe it or not, there are two deal breakers there.  One, can Siena serve a vegetarian dish that a meat eater will not only sample but possibly order in the future.  Answer:  yes.  It was delicious without being over buttered, cheesed, or whatever.  Clean but crisp flavors, and yet with warmer undertones like a perfect cologne.  Two, angel hair pasta isn't worth ordering because most restaurants overcook it into a baseball of stringy goo.   Or they cook it okay, but it continues cooking on the dishes and dies before you finish it.  Nope.  Siena nailed this dish.

I ordered a chicken marsala.  Now this dish is relatively easy to prepare.  Even bad marsala is still good marsala.   But excellent marsala leaves the chicken terribly juicy and tasty, and this dish didn't disappoint.  The men from the boys situation was --

-- the side dish.  Firstly, Siena allowed me to substitute my mashed potatoes for pesto gnocchi.  I had to pay two additional dollars but it still only came out to something like $18.  On the strip this same meal would have been $28 and no substitutions thank you.  Secondly, Gnocchi comes two ways:  frozen factory (garbage) or handmade on the premises (heaven).  It's super easy to tell the difference, and this gnocchi was homemade.  You won't make this dish right at home, and so Siena gives you the chance to visit Italian heaven.  Do it.  If you have two couples, order as an appetizer to split.  With a salad.

But testing this restaurant wasn't over yet.  My partner ordered ricotta cheesecake.  Another item that's usually not worth ordering these days.  For anyone who doesn't know this:  the cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory is lame and unacceptable.  Siena's cheesecake was not only the real McCoy, but had almondine and liqueur touches which closed the deal.

Siena is the best Italian food Restaurant I've had so far in Vegas.  It should replace the Onda in the Mirage.  It's not as classy and innovative as Olive's in Bellagio, but Siena simply serves better Italian food while not being too classic and boring... for a third of the price.  (You read that right.)  My favorite strip Italian (so far) is Rao's in Caesars, but Rao's has a hit or miss menu.  And they stopped serving real gnocchi a year or so ago to maximize profits.  Corporate, corporate, corporate.

(In my first draft of this review, I neglected to mention how solid the service was from Justin.  A week has passed since he served us and I still remember his name.  That doesn't happen often for me.)

But since I'm a born critic, I've got to say something bad about Siena.  Okay --

1.  The location blows unless you're a local.   I'm talking about the location being off strip, not the building itself.  But speaking of which --

2. -- the interior is nice (reminds me of a HOUSTONS), but the exterior is bland suburban stripmall tan stucco YUCCO.  The good news there is that the remainder of suburban Vegas is identically wretched and so they don't stand out in that way.  However --

3.  -- the restaurant's name and logo are too long and hard to remember.  THIS CAN KILL A PLACE.  How can you recommend something if you can't remember what it's called.  SIENA is nice and neat.  They should even consider SIENA ON SAHARA, which tells strip visitors WHERE it is and infers there will be more locations.  If you want advice on how to make the sign better, hire the guy who did FIREFLY next door.  Siena's exterior look and signage screamed 'local mistake' and yet the interior and food scream "You'll be back."

Give it a try, Yelpers.  And Siena owners -- open a second location as close to the strip as possible.  Inside a property if you can manage it.

We went to the Deli, the cappucino was delicious. I had the eggplant sandwich and the sauce was out of this world. My husband had the sausage and peppers, a perfect dish for a hungry man. Very friendly and efficient staff. A welcoming place for breakfast or lunch, I'd love to try the beautiful dining room for dinner.

Solid Italian food...good, just not great.  The atmosphere is nice, and they had live music playing in the background on this Sunday afternoon.

Started off with the Formaggiere ($12.75): Carboncino, Pecorino Pepato, Fontina, and Fontinella cheeses. They were all pretty good, and the portions were fair since we had about 3-4 pieces of each.

Also tried the Gnocchi al Pesto ($13.75): Homemade Potato & Ricotta Dumpling in Pesto. This was pretty good! A little more starchy than I've had, but the pesto sauce was fantastic.  This was the highlight of meal for me.

Lasagna ($13.75): Meat Sauce, Ricotta, Parmesan, & Mozzarella Cheese. This was good overall, but the inside was a little cooler than the rest.  The hot parts weren't very mentionable either...I'd skip this one personally.  

Overall, I don't think you can go WRONG...it's just difficult when I compare it to my other favorites in Vegas.

Pics :

semi fabu enough italian specialty counter....all standard fare...serviceable enough that I have found especially for this side of the valley. all lovely...when the counter staff actually acknowledges your presence. if you can take the lacking service in stride....happy antipasto plates for your home abound.

I was visiting friends in Summerlin who highly recommended the deli here for lunch.

The menus above the counter are extremely small, so bring your glasses if you're as near-sighted as I am. I let my friends order for me (I'm not joking - I literally couldn't read anything). They chose the Garden sandwich, which came out to just under $9 with tax.

We paid at the counter, and took our numbered placard to the outdoor seating area. Within 10 minutes, our food was whisked to our table by the waiter. One bite of my toasted, cheesey, melty, vegetarian sandwich and I was hooked. You could taste how fresh the ingredients were. You know this is a true Italian deli by the obvious care they put into feeding people.

The experience of dining al fresco was somewhat marred by the old guys smoking cigars at the next table. The breeze whipped the smoke right into our faces. Otherwise - buonissimo!

Met a date for dinner.....Ordered the pad Thai. 
The dish was so poor tasting. very disappointed.
I didn't let the waiter know because I was on a date.
The service was good.
Food....not so good.
Excellent greeting from Carolina. Service overall was fantastic. We had the cheese pizza which was very tasty. Overall, I would return.

I am an Asian addict. I rarely eat anything that does not come from that lovely continent. I mean it is the largest and most populated, so odds are they're going to have some winning cuisines--and they do. But, yesterday, I managed to take myself to Siena, an Italian restaurant.

The interior, while not trendsetting, is nice and clean. They are in the middle of a big remodel as they are adding a patio and some other features, like a deli, which I think will be nice as my understanding is they are going for a more caf√© feel for that section. Cafes are a welcome addition to my hood.

The service got the job done but without finesse or flair. Honestly, I think he decided we were not a valuable table when we started out by just ordering water. I was a server once, and I know when a table goes for the tap you start thinking they're cheapos, but, it's just not right. I noticed that he told another table the specials, but not us. We clearly weren't "special" material. He didn't refill our water glasses once. Still, the service was not terrible; it just wasn't remarkable.

As for the food, it was good, but not a good value. I was honestly a little excited to see a salad with apples on the menu. I am a sucker for fruit and greens, but when the salad arrived, it had 4 thin slices on the corner of the plate. That is really more of a garnish and perhaps not worthy of a line item mention on a menu. If they upped the apple quotient, I think this could be a really craveable salad, as the cheese, walnuts and vinaigrette were done well. We also ordered the Healthy Choice pasta: organic & whole-wheat angel hair roasted tomatoes, sundried tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, and fresh basil. I loved the bountiful, fresh slices of garlic. If I had made this dish at home, I'd be giving myself a big hug. However, I paid $14.75 for it, and the portion was a little small. I am not ready to dole out hugs for that. 

To end on a positive note: The breadbasket and olive tapenade were delicious. The bread came out hot and fresh, and it has become quite a challenge to find a hot breadbasket in this town. Those loafs alone are earning Siena 3 stars, but I probably won't return until the caf√© is finished. In the meantime, catch me in Chinatown.

Came here after trying to get service at Nacho Daddy next door.   Upon entering we were quickly greeted by the bartender who promptly took our order and brought us our drinks.   The atmosphere was much better than next door and so many good choices of drinks and appetizers for their happy hour.   Slightly older crowd without the pounding music you get at some of the other happy hour places. Classy place.

While out and about early on a Sunday looking for a bite to eat we saw their tiny lit up sign in the window that read "OPEN".  I looked at the hubs and we thought...why not!  They offer a full menu on Sundays along with a brunch menu. 

We decided on a full meal rather than brunch.  I split the small chopped salad that tasted great!  It was full of fresh cut meats and cheese along with some red onion and garbanzo beans.  All tossed in their great tasting caesar dressing.  I had the rigatoni bolognese.  The serving was HUGE and was incredible.  We were served some bread that tasted fresh!

Service was spectacular!  Our water glasses were filled multiple times.  I look forward to stopping my their deli in the near future or even planning a night out with my husband.  This place has a great warm ambiance.  I noticed they have a nice looking bar too!

Went for a late dinner, the dining room was closed, but there was plenty of room in the bar area. There was live music, that was targeted for a little older crowd. The food was tasty, but not delicious. Comfortable atmosphere and good service.

Went in today for dinner since it's national spaghetti day. I had plain old fashion spaghetti and meatballs and it was fantastic. The sauce is delicious and the meatballs were great. 

I genuinely love this place.

Giving three stars because the food was good as usual and normally the service is good. This is the first time the service was very bad. It took a long time to have our order taken and even though a glass of wine was ordered during the initial drink request she didn't bring it out until the food came out and it had to be asked for twice.   My tea glass sit empty, we were only checked on once and we were not asked if we wanted desert or coffee. We were very surprised at the service this time as it is usually perfect.

One of my new favorite restaurants. Great long Happy Hour prices in a bar with a nice crowd buzz. 
Size of drinks are generous. Ate in the restaurant area and had the 14oz. NY steak with polenta and asparagus. It was delicious and for only $25. Good bread and service. Everyone enjoyed their meal at our table. Will definitely be hanging out here.

Finally made it to Siena Italian after driving by daily and wanting to check it out since I moved back to Vegas a year ago. The food was fantastic! We started with the Burrata and Heirloom tomato followed by a salad (I forget the name) with mixed greens, toasted walnuts, gorgonzola and sliced apples. Entrees at the table were the Veal Piccata, Tagliata di Manzo, a New Zealand Snapper special and a Grouper special. All were exceptional and very reasonably priced. We finished with a couple desserts and more satisfied we could not have been. Service? Probably would have to give that 3 stars. Our server was very nice but not very detail oriented and not very attentive.  We didnt get an appetizer we ordered (which may have not been his fault) and we got a cappuccino instead of an espresso that my sister ordered. It wasn't very busy and for the quality of the food and beautiful decor that they have, I feel the service should be a bit more attentive and professional. I will definitely be back because the food was so good but maybe next time sit in the bar. Live music on Friday was a nice addition too.

I JUST HAD THE BEST LUNCH EVER!!!! CARB-TASTIC!!!
I almost feel I should leave this review in two parts.....one for a take-out experience and one later for a dine-in.

Today is the Take-Out.

So, on the suggestion of the Awesome Princess Crystal Dawn.....the conversation went kinda like this :
Damon : I'm hungry.
Crystal : Well, I have a cure for that?
Damon : Oh really?
Crystal : Yes, really, Siena.
Damon :  Who's that?
Crystal :  It's an AWESOME Italian Deli.

....and history was made.  I clocked out for my lunch break eager to feed on something from anywhere new.   Walking into Siena is like walking into charm.  You are automatically surrounded by deli that could easily be a movie set.  I took a number.  Ordered the days special Fettuccine and Red Sauce with Chicken and Eggplant.   Oh, and  3 canolli.  The wait was a little long, but who cares, there was just so much to take in.  The hanging sausage, the cheeses, the baked goods tempting me at the front case.   Anything and everything you could possibly want and thought you could only find in NYC.

I walk out the door lunch in hand.   As I'm driving back to work I realize I can't wait to partake of one of the canolli.   Now my roommate constantly touts the beauty of the canollli, but let me tell you, I've had a few,Vegas canolli aren't a beauty....at least until now.  All 3 found their way into my mouth before I parked my car.  Ummmm...WOW.  Why eat anything else EVER!!!  Why move on to the (what felt like 5lbs. of pasta) Fettuccine I had actually intended to be my lunch.   But I did it, and it was worth it. ( I can't believe I ate the WHOLE thing. )  Now my friends, I need a nap. Next time I'll stay and take more time.  Try that beautiful Sicilian pizza they had.  Until then  canolli wishes and spumoni dreams.

Siena Deli - FOR THE FAMILY, BY THE FAMILY

Review is specifically for happy hour: 
     Good happy hour, food is very good and drinks are reasonable especially considering the quality of the place, the owners are usually there and are from Italy. The crowd that goes there are very nice. Recommended!!!  My last review I complained about the service but on a return visit, I believe the problem has been corrected ....

We went here for the Italian car show and also to try out the food. I was starving so we passed by the beautiful cars and ate first. 

There's a casual deli area and a nicer dining area. A live band was playing. What caught my attention was the flyer for F1 which I'm crazy about. Ferrari, F1 and food...I was in a very happy place.

After the bread service with olives, we got 4 different cheeses (Fontina, Fontinella, Locatelli and Pecorino), gnocchi al pesto and lasagna. I wanted carboncino but they were out. We ordered the Pecorino with truffles but was given pecorino pepato instead. I knew there was nothing that tasted like truffles on that cheese plate we got.

Gnocchi al Pesto:
I love gnocchi and pesto so it was an easy decision to get this. Huge serving and lots of sauce. We were using bread to get rid of the excess pesto. The gnocchi was tasty and soft and the sauce was quite good. I don't know of any other places in Vegas that has gnocchi in pesto. 4/5

Lasagna:
Their version brings back great childhood memories when we'd go to this small restaurant that serves good lasagna after going to a funeral or the airport. Tasty. The outside was hot but the middle wasn't. 3.5/5

We ended our meal by admiring and taking pictures of cars at the parking lot. Ferrari, Lamborghini, Maserati, Alfa Romeo and few Fiats. Who needs dessert?

Great place for italian food. Price point is excellent. 
You can choose from the deli side or the sit down restaurant.  Bar has Great happy hour. Service was average. Linguini clams are great and pasta carbonara.  Yummy. Will definitely go back.
Typically, I go here everyday for soup because they are amazing and delicious. I am so disappointed in what I got today. I guess I'll take a break for awhile it's unacceptable.

Had a party of 18 yesterday celebrating my best friend's birthday. Nice atmosphere inside, GM/Owner seated us then checked on us later that night to see how things were going. Served the kids first then the adults which was nice since they were getting antsy. Food was delicious. Only minor complaint was it wasn't very busy and service was on the slow side; however, no one botched up orders, brought us anything we had asked for and always remained courteous. Thank you. Id love to try something new next time!

Dinner Thursday February 15th.  We decided to go and try Siena.  A birthday celebration.  I brought a small cake and candle for the occasion. More about that later.  2 of us ordered chix parm over angel hair pasta.  Very good. The birthday girl ordered the recommended salmon, grilled over spinach. Great.  I ordered a pizza, good and a small caesar salad.  All and all the food was very good. The service was excellent.  Now let me finish my cake story.  Our waiter served the cake and we all sang, we had a very nice time, that is until the waiter brought us yne bill.  He said that there was a service charge for the cake service.  Not a problem I thought until I noticed the amount.  $20.00 service charge.  $10.00 would have been fine but $20.00 is excessive, no rediculous.  When I asked the manager she seemed puzzled, she said she would check with the manager and just went about her business.  Not a great way to run a business, what due think?  When i handed her the cake upon arrival she did not mention a charge.

As I entered into this fabulous Italian restaurant.  I was greeted with warmth and a great big welcome. Let's put it this way great Italian style.  Gina Linzi the restaurants general manager was so kind to take us on a tour of the restaurant and Authentic Italian deli that has every Italian delicacy that you can imagine. From the varieties of formaggio (cheese) Olives from different regions of Italy oh not to mention the Italian gelato and pastries. I can go on and on. You must see for yourself. Gina then proceeded to sit us at the bar area for Happy hour and let me tell you this is not just a happy hr. It was a feast!! The best Italian feast. Gian Carlo the owner was so gracious to proudly serve us 2 great pasta dishes that were out of this world. Along with the fried calamari which was so tender. The lamb chops were sensational every bite was heaven. The variety of cheeses along with figs and fig jam. They do great meat and cheese boards. Great musical entertainment after 830 in bar area. Get there at around seven to enjoy the great experience. Gian Carlo and Gina are great hosts and you will never experience this gastronomic adventure if you Dont get there and try it for yourself. My hats off to Siena Authentic Trattorria!!! Miraviglioso per tutti!!

Marianne Foti
Universal Realty

As far as the deli is concerned, this place appears to have it all, pasta, cheeses, deli meats, sauces, bread, etc. We ventured here for lunch on a weekday and surprisingly it was completely empty. The 4 of us ordered from the lunch specials and received the complimentary bread and olive tapenade. The server was very friendly and super attentive, yet again we were the only ones there for the first 30 minutes. I ordered the ciabatta steak sandwich lunch special which came with fried fingerling potatoes. The potatoes were quite tasty, a mix of purple, red, golden and sweet potatoes. The sandwich however, left a lot to be desired. The description was a thinly sliced steak sandwich. What I received was a skirt steak with absolutely no flavor and way too thick to just take a bite of. My first bite extracted the whole slice of meat from the bread so I resorted to cutting the steak piece by piece and eating the bread separately. I wouldn't have minded having to do this if the sandwich had more flavor but it was just blah and boring. The sandwich itself was very large and I was only able to finish one half of it. My friends had the cold cut sandwich, the vegetarian sandwich and the pear salad. They all enjoyed their dishes without complaint. For dessert we all ordered the gelato. It redeemed the meal for me! I had the spumoni flavor and it was creamy and fresh. If I ever return I would definitely order one of the pasta dishes next time.

It's my birthday and we were out for dinner.  Were should we go?  We decided to try something new and this was our choice.  We have passed by many times, but never really noticed this place.  So walking in, we were surprised by the deli.  The display cases full of sweets and other treats including wonderful sausages and fresh made pastas. 

They also serve cooked items, for a take home meal.  And of course there are loaded shelves with various grocery items.  After a lingering walk through, we made into an almost empty restaurant.  I think we may have been the second table.  It was early evening but I was still a bit concern with no dinner crowd.

Our server came right away and we made a couple of appetizer selections.  I tried the polenta sauteed porcini.  Loaded with mushrooms and assorted seafood on top of grilled polenta.   It was very savory good. They had just cooked off some homemade sausages and brought us a "wheel" gratis.  I love sausage, so this was a wonderful addition to the meal.

For my entree I got the "zuppa reale" which is a bouillabaisse with seafood, in fish broth and chopped tomatoes.   It was a bit spicy and very good especially with the assortment of breads to soak up the broth.  

The server and the assistants were quick on service, kept our tea glasses full and promptly removed our empty plates.  We admit that it was really good meal, and we do want to return soon.  

One of the menu items that might entice us to come again, is the high protein meal, called Misto Carne Alla Griglia, marinated grilled homemade sausages, pork ribs, chicken and steak.  When we are low "carbing", this would make a great meal!

When you walk into this place it's kind of intimidating with all the pasta and sauces and olives to purchase but after about five seconds you learn how wonderful it is to have a place like this.
 
  The people are always nice and helpful with all the choices. Now, I've only had lunch here but if the diner is as good as the lunch, I bet its spectacular! I always get the Sicilian Sandwich and it's on the mark, I can't understand how this simple sandwich is so good but I could never get my sandwiches to taste that good. The bread is fresh and the meat well is from the deli so its awesome.
   My only complaint would be not having a soda fountain in the deli/lunch area but they do have bottled soda and water
   I'm a huge cannoli fan so when I can get one to try I do, they have three sizes sm. med, large so went for the Med not knowing the size difference. I should have went for the large cause the med seemed small. They have a lot of deserts to try and I look forward to trying more. All the frozen pasta I've bought and cooked at home has been wonderful. So, If you want a good sandwich go for the Sicilian or chicken parmesan they are outstanding.
This is a nice all around Italian deli/restaurant.    We had sandwiches at the deli and it was good.   A bit pricy but worth the extra cost.    I will be going back soon!

Any restaurant that gives out 4 different menus to order from has a problem. 
I had the lamb chops which were over cooked. The Quiche was microwaved. The cheesecake topping was so hard from sitting around it was literally tough to cut.
News 3 mentioned if you order brunch you get a comp mimosa. Partial truth. Only one per table.  What a joke. 
The fact that it was dead should have been our indication to go elsewhere

Next time you are looking for something to do with your special lady on a sunny weekend, head to Siena and order the squingili salad, the mixed olives, broccoli raub, gelato, marinated mushrooms, stuffed artichokes, two Manhattan Specials, and a seeded round and have yourselves a nice picnic at Sunset Park, and then go play tag.

There were six of us. We had a great time, great food and very good service. This was my first visit to the restaurant, I go to the deli side on a weekly basis. We started off with cold antipasto platter, that would have made most people say omg! It had various salami, cheese, prosciutto, mortadella, artichoke hearts and more...seemed endless. I chose the Pesci Misto, all grilled to perfection seafood with a side of linguine, excellent. Others had Rigatoni Bolognese, pork belly which had a rich flavor, almost Moroccan and delicious. A whole Braszini fish, served table-side and finally a grilled octopus. I'm told Thursday night is entertainment night and the music was very good. This is a great place, we'll be back
One of the best Italians food on the west side. They have many many different wines. Everything is good here. Enjoy it every time.

The eggplant parmesan sandwich was delicious the Sicilian cold cut sandwich lacked cold cuts the bread was delicious but cookies were old and dry that must have been why they were 50% off and still almost $9 a pound

This was my third happy hour visit. I love the atmosphere and the menu choices. I encouraged the ladies to come here for a birthday and was a bit disappointed. The service was slow this time which hampered the evening. I encouraged ordering the lamb chops since we enjoyed them on another visit. This time they lacked flavor. The happy hour salad was okay but was drenched in dressing. We appreciated the birthday girl's free tiramisu but why didn't the waitress tell us when the birthday girl ordered the cannoli's? My friend was disappointed in the crab cakes. It was not an ideal visit. I will consider returning since other visits were enjoyable.

Service was very poor. We sat in the bar area and had to wait long time for anybody to come to the table and even longer for the waiter, who was also attending the bar,  to come back, despite very few people in the restaurant that evening.  Food was standard Italian-nothing interested or particularly tasty. Ambience was Ok, again standard restaurant. Prices high for the quality of the food and even higher for the quality of the service. Not good value. There are many better Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.
Great italian food great service been here before and will come again plus all my favorite deli meats right in the same place awesome delicious

I've finally had the chance to experience this eating establishment.  It's one of those places that I've driven by many times. Despite intending to go in. Finally, my beautiful one and decided to celebrate our anniversary there. First staff is very inviting and attentive. Atmosphere and Ambience was very delightful. We also like the fact that even though there was music playing overhead and people were talking the noise level was very good where we could at least have an intimate conversation without screaming at each other. The menu was very extensive there was a very good variety of choices of authentic Italian food. We started off ordering off of the happy hour menu with crab cakes and shrimp scampi. The food came out an adequate time. The crab cakes were moist very good texture fried perfectly with a small side salad sprinkle lightly with Thousand Island dressing. Shrimp scampi was very tasty season very well and the shrimp melted in my mouth. 4 on tree get the angel hair shrimp and also the veal Milanese. Both entrees were prepared just right presentation was over average. After dinner we had dessert and coffee those two were very pleasing and satisfying nice place to take a special person or the date that you just want to make a nice impression.

Never would've thought a place as great as this would be in such a crappy plaza/mall area but who cares?  This place rocks!  Picked up lunch here for the wife and I.  I went with the linguine fra diavolo with calamari and spinach...I'm always a sucker for squid!  My wife went with the fresh mozzarella sandwich caprese style and we got a slice of cheese to split.  

All of the stuff was great.  The pasta dish was huge and the sicilian slice was a welcome change from the usual offerings of most Vegas pizza joints.  So much stuff I wanna try the next time we go back.  Can't wait!

This is one of the best italan restaurants in Vegas but its a hole in the wall so not many people know about it. Their gnocchi pesto and penne vodka with sausage it TO DIE FOR.  They import a lot of their products from New York or Italy so everything I have ever had here is amazing.  Anyone I have ever brought here felt the same. Service is always on point, quick to greet and get our food to us within 15-20 minutes. Their garlic and pesto spread for the bread is also amazing and homemade. Try thi place out if you haven't already, you won't regret it.

Siena definitely has a great selection of food. My boyfriend and I always try to go during their happy hour, the menu is priced great! Although sometimes when sitting at the bar, the service isn't always as great as it could be. But love the food and the live music.

Im going to miss being able to walk here.  I come here mostly for the deli which serves fresh bread, sausage in and out of the casing, fresh sauces and homemade pasta at reasonable prices.  Fed three people lobster ravioli with alfredo sauce, a baguette, a half pound of sausage(out of casing) and had plenty of leftover sauce.  

In the restaurant the food is very good.  I have never had any meal that I could say was a disappointment.  What keeps it from a 5th star is that I have also never had a meal that knocked my socks off.  The staff is always friendly, helpful with the menu and suggestions, and on top of the water and bread baskets.  The seating could be a little more on the comfort side of things but the no frills approach probably keeps the prices from escalating out of control.  I enjoy coming here with the family and it is a good date spot as well.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. 

I usually order a chopped salad to start. Get the smaller size or share the larger size because there is plenty. The meats and cheese they use in the salad come from their own deli next door. The salad is always fresh and tasty. A creature of habit, I usually order the linguini vongole for my entree. And it never disappoints. Lots of clams still in the shell and the linguini is excellent. My wife has tried a wider variety of things on the menu: rissoto, sausage and peppers, lasagna, and spaghetti bolognese. She has been pleased with all. My only complaint was the dessert we ordered to go. It was the non-flour chocolate cake. I'd describe it as a sliver. But we have had their creme br√ªl√©e, and it was good. 

The atmosphere is relaxing with lower lighting and darker wood. In the evenings, there is usually a singer in the large bar area. The music ranges from the '40's to the '90's. 

All in all, we consistently enjoy a nice meal and relaxing atmosphere every time we dine here.

We went for brunch from a friend's recommendation for a amazing experience with a singer. Mark Antonelli didn't disappoint!! My best friend was visiting from Germany and this made her trip.

We ordered eggs Benedict and when I ordered I told the waiter that I love eggs Benedict but I need the eggs poached soft and runny. (Eggs Benny are my favorite) They came and the sauce sad cold, the yolk was almost the consistency of a hard boiled egg. 

We will try brunch again because the entertainment was so good ...we will dry something Italian next time I think.

Great place.  Food, entertainment and service was great.  We had the calamari for appetizer and for dinner we had the fettucini alfredo with sausage and Pesce Misto.  Delicious! Must try.  We will definitely be back.  Happy Hour until 7 pm!

Pretty standard for an Italian place. The food was good but not super amazing. The service was okay too, our waiter was really rushed and would walk away before we were done talking to him. The prices were a little high for what you actually get but not outrageous or anything. Overall the it's has a nice atmosphere and a consistent taste so I'd definitely give it another try.

We ate at the deli.  Their eggplant Parmesan sandwich was delicious, but only contained one thin layer of eggplant (perhaps one quarter of 1 inch thick).  For the price, it was poor value although quite tasty.

Very nice dinner, and very authentic Italian.   Three out of four diners in our party loved their entree's, while fourth was a bit bland.   Service was very good, and atmosphere is also nice, with live music playing in the bar.  While we live aboug 45 minutes away, not sure I would come back that often, but if we lived closer, we would for sure be there often.
This place is amazing. The deli is great for lunch, and the atmosphere is awesome at night. Love music and the best bartender Josh :) I would come back just to see this guy!!

Italian restaurant has gr8 menu w/good service and nice ambiance.  My veal picatta was so so as the lemon sauce drowned the veal flavor.  Salads are good and you can get half portions.  Gr8 wine selection.  Fiance had gr8 Italian fish dish.  Pasta is traditionally done very well.  Gr8 desserts and deli.  Prices are reasonable.  Ample parking.

I made reservations for Valentine's Day two weeks in advance, when we showed up they said our table was taken and that a couple had been sitting in there for two hours and refused to leave which we found out was not necessarily the case. The lady at the reservation desk was rude about it until I told her that my husband was home from deployment and had not seen him in five months.

While I understand Valentine's Day can be very crowded but with proper planning their restaurant would not have been such chaos. When the waiter came and took her order I specifically told him a New York steak medium rare, he delivered a cold Gristle laden rub eye that was 75% fat the hors d'oeuvres were cold and not fully cooked and my husband and I ended up taking a few bites leaving the restaurant still hungry. I seriously would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!

Beautiful food and great service! Had the surf n turf and husband had the osso buco.  Food was good, service excellent, prices very reasonable,  and the place is beautifully designed and comfortable.  We will definitely go back!  Make a reservation if you go on a weekend.

Sat at the bar for a casual drink and dinner. Bartenders acted friendly but were  not attentive, unless you were a regular.  Ordered burrata and after almost 25 minutes waiting I was brought something that looked like a fish. Obviously the bartender entered wrong item. It happens. But not one apology. Eventually got my burrata and it was nothing special. Heirloom tomato was very soft. All in all, too many choices in Vegas to settle for the food and service I received this night.

The good: the pasta is actually tasty; my ravioli tasted fresh and house-made, as opposed to something out of a frozen package. The filling was also good.
The so-so: the sauce tasted like it came out of a can--very basic, uninteresting. The price point is a bit high considering that. The lunch specials do not look particularly good, so I opted for a dish off the regular menu.
The awkward: two members of the staff bickered a bit while I was eating. I think that was probably an isolated occurrence though.

Overall, there are some definite positives, and the pasta is a standout. But I wish it came with a better sauce, or a lower price point.

Nice selection of deli items, but would not recommend the breakfast service!  A side order was not delivered until after we finished the meal and it took some time to adjust the bill even though we were the only diners at the time
First time there and I really am a fan. Had the lunch special meat cannelloni and it was the best I've ever had. The deli is very well stocked and the Italian cookies are great. I will return!
Always a wonderful meal and experience when we visit Sienna.  The staff is very attentive.

Good food and good locale; inconsistent and adequate service. Lady behind counter can't multitask, you have to wait between each request, I.e. Ordering cookies, only one at a time...needs improvement, but I will continue to go.
Revisited Siena to give it a second chance.  Going to recant my previous statement that I will continue to go.  Deli has no supervision and if you ask for any special request, the staff cannot process it. Asked for a cappuccino in a to-go cup, couldn't comprehend what I wanted. Received a small ceramic mug.  Sausage, pepper and egg sandwich changed. Used to be served mixed together with real eggs, now tastes like egg beaters and everything is separated, layered on top of each other. plus peppers and onions were cold and raw.
Too bad they let the place go, glad we still have Roma Deli...

It has been a while since I've eaten at the Siena Trattoria and since our air conditioner is still out we decided to have dinner out.
We started with what they call their "buongustaio". It's essentially a meat tray with a few small chunks of cheese, several olives (like 4 or 5) and a small dollop of roasted red peppers. I admit to enjoying the dish more than my wife did but I love prosciutto and theirs was well sliced (critical) and very tasty. It's a lot for two people to eat as an appetizer so we saved half to take home. For dinner my wife had a chicken Caesar salad which she really liked. She enjoyed the taste and the portion size (adequate but not huge). I had lasagna (being 100% Italian and all) and really enjoyed it. The portion size was good, the sauce delicious and the consistency just right. Sometimes lasagna can fall apart or be like it's made in a mold but not the lasagna served at Siena Trattoria. It was great. The service was excellent throughout. I'm sure we won't be waiting this long again between visits.

Really good place for wine, cheese and meat trays.  We went for dinner.  Next time we will try the cheeses and meats.  Very good sauces with the stuffed ravioli.  Excellent customer service and very friendly owner.

First time trying this place. Uninspiring food, I decided to have calamari and gnocchi with pesto. Calamari was tender But I wish the batter was lighter and the marinara that it came with was no so heavy with tomatoes. Gnocchi was a disaster, it was soo mushy... I could only eat 1/3 of it. I'm not a person who sends back stuff. I decided not to finish it, just won't be back for another helping.

We were in town for Hubby's birthday weekend and his aunt took us to eat at this restaurant for lunch on a Saturday.  Loved the decor and the cute deli/market next door.  There were 6 of us and we were greeted warmly and seated promptly.  We started off with calamari and bread and tapanade.  I was told the bread is baked fresh daily onsite and I was not disappointed.  The tapandade was muah muah good.  I could not get enough of both!  I thought to myself if the bread and tapandade were that good enough to make me do my happy dance in my seat then the food must be amazing.  I was not disappointed!  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Especially the housemade sausage that came with Hubby's meal.

The staff was all very attentive and we never had to ask for anything.  Water and drinks were always filled.  Even the owners came by to ask how we were doing.  This place is a class act.  Highly recommended!

If that is how a dissatisfied customer is handled, id hate to see how your kitchen works. MARC T: 20 min late doesnt justify ICE COLD PIZZA.
